閱讀 第1回

 
Q1. The young man owes his success to many people, his parents ______.

(A) on purpose
(B) by chance
(C) at random
(D) in particular
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q2. He was late for the meeting ______ the heavy rain.

(A) on account of
(B) in case of
(C) in spite of
(D) apart from
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q3. Group registrations are not allowed. Each member must register for the conference ______.

(A) comfortably
(B) individually
(C) intelligently
(D) respectfully
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q4. The woman is so ______ that she cries every time she hears a sad story.

(A) casual
(B) harsh
(C) intimate
(D) sentimental
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q5. If we walk at this ______, we'll never get to our destination on time.

(A) mood
(B) pace
(C) tide
(D) access
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q6. Our English teacher was very busy ______ a lecture.

(A) prepare
(B) preparing
(C) to prepare
(D) to be prepared
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q7. We shall expect you at eight o'clock; ______, it's an informal dinner.

(A) by accident
(B) by all means
(C) by the way
(D) by then
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q8. Thousands of products ______ from coal are now in daily use.

(A) made
(B) make
(C) making
(D) to make
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q9. Stop beating ______ the bush and tell me exactly what you want.

(A) around
(B) at
(C) for
(D) in
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q10. The library is famous for its wide ______ of books. You can find all kinds of books there.

(A) technology
(B) connection
(C) variety
(D) amazement
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q11. If we had known your new address, we ______ to see you then.

(A) came
(B) will come
(C) would come
(D) would have come
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q12. It goes without ______ that Isaac Stern is among the greatest violinists.

(A) saying
(B) speaking
(C) telling
(D) talking
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q13. We visited the place ______ Abraham Lincoln was born.

(A) which
(B) where
(C) that
(D) what
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q14. It's impossible ______ everyone; just do what you think is right.

(A) to pleasing
(B) to please
(C) please
(D) pleased
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q15. The moment I ______ the news, I became very excited.

(A) have heard
(B) hear
(C) heard
(D) was hearing
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
        After I finished primary school, my family moved to Keelung in northern Taiwan. Keelung is _(16)_ known for its changeable weather. For example, I had heard that Keelung was Taiwan's "rainy city." However, I couldn't appreciate that _(17)_ I experienced it later.
　　The morning was sunny and hot when I went to visit a friend. We decided to _(18)_ a stroll in the hills near his house. When we arrived in the woods, it started to rain _(19)_. We were completely unprepared. It was even a little dangerous because the small streams there had become more like rivers. We got back to his house safely, but we both looked like drowned rats!
　　Ever since that day I _(20)_ an umbrella with me, even when there are no clouds in the sky. Keelung isn't called Taiwan's "rainy city" for nothing!
 
Q16. (A) far
(B) well
(C) very
(D) so
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        After I finished primary school, my family moved to Keelung in northern Taiwan. Keelung is _(16)_ known for its changeable weather. For example, I had heard that Keelung was Taiwan's "rainy city." However, I couldn't appreciate that _(17)_ I experienced it later.
　　The morning was sunny and hot when I went to visit a friend. We decided to _(18)_ a stroll in the hills near his house. When we arrived in the woods, it started to rain _(19)_. We were completely unprepared. It was even a little dangerous because the small streams there had become more like rivers. We got back to his house safely, but we both looked like drowned rats!
　　Ever since that day I _(20)_ an umbrella with me, even when there are no clouds in the sky. Keelung isn't called Taiwan's "rainy city" for nothing!
 
Q17. (A) and
(B) because
(C) until
(D) after
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        After I finished primary school, my family moved to Keelung in northern Taiwan. Keelung is _(16)_ known for its changeable weather. For example, I had heard that Keelung was Taiwan's "rainy city." However, I couldn't appreciate that _(17)_ I experienced it later.
　　The morning was sunny and hot when I went to visit a friend. We decided to _(18)_ a stroll in the hills near his house. When we arrived in the woods, it started to rain _(19)_. We were completely unprepared. It was even a little dangerous because the small streams there had become more like rivers. We got back to his house safely, but we both looked like drowned rats!
　　Ever since that day I _(20)_ an umbrella with me, even when there are no clouds in the sky. Keelung isn't called Taiwan's "rainy city" for nothing!
 
Q18. (A) take
(B) make
(C) do
(D) go on
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        After I finished primary school, my family moved to Keelung in northern Taiwan. Keelung is _(16)_ known for its changeable weather. For example, I had heard that Keelung was Taiwan's "rainy city." However, I couldn't appreciate that _(17)_ I experienced it later.
　　The morning was sunny and hot when I went to visit a friend. We decided to _(18)_ a stroll in the hills near his house. When we arrived in the woods, it started to rain _(19)_. We were completely unprepared. It was even a little dangerous because the small streams there had become more like rivers. We got back to his house safely, but we both looked like drowned rats!
　　Ever since that day I _(20)_ an umbrella with me, even when there are no clouds in the sky. Keelung isn't called Taiwan's "rainy city" for nothing!
 
Q19. (A) mice and rats
(B) rats and mice
(C) dogs and cats
(D) cats and dogs
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        After I finished primary school, my family moved to Keelung in northern Taiwan. Keelung is _(16)_ known for its changeable weather. For example, I had heard that Keelung was Taiwan's "rainy city." However, I couldn't appreciate that _(17)_ I experienced it later.
　　The morning was sunny and hot when I went to visit a friend. We decided to _(18)_ a stroll in the hills near his house. When we arrived in the woods, it started to rain _(19)_. We were completely unprepared. It was even a little dangerous because the small streams there had become more like rivers. We got back to his house safely, but we both looked like drowned rats!
　　Ever since that day I _(20)_ an umbrella with me, even when there are no clouds in the sky. Keelung isn't called Taiwan's "rainy city" for nothing!
 
Q20. (A) began to take
(B) will take
(C) have taken
(D) would take
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Only one of Taiwan island's sixteen counties does not border the ocean: NanTou County. _(21)_ in the center of Taiwan, NanTou is a land of contrasts. On the one hand, it enjoys the best climate. The many small lakes, rivers, and forests there also offer natural beauty. Some locals even say the most beautiful women in Taiwan come from ShuiLi, a town in this _(22)_ land.
　　On _(23)_ hand, NanTou has some of the island's worst natural disasters. The great earthquake of 1999 was centered here, and floods are _(24)_ too frequent in this otherwise peaceful land. It seems that NanTou has much to _(25)_, at a price.
 
Q21. (A) Lain
(B) Located
(C) Arranged
(D) Formed
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Only one of Taiwan island's sixteen counties does not border the ocean: NanTou County. _(21)_ in the center of Taiwan, NanTou is a land of contrasts. On the one hand, it enjoys the best climate. The many small lakes, rivers, and forests there also offer natural beauty. Some locals even say the most beautiful women in Taiwan come from ShuiLi, a town in this _(22)_ land.
　　On _(23)_ hand, NanTou has some of the island's worst natural disasters. The great earthquake of 1999 was centered here, and floods are _(24)_ too frequent in this otherwise peaceful land. It seems that NanTou has much to _(25)_, at a price.

(B) scenic
(C) comic
(D) panic

試題解說

(B) most
(C) all
(D) some

[文章中譯]

Q25. (A) act
(B) escape
(C) deny
(D) offer
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q26. The Nortons have two children aged 12 and 7. Which of the following tours can they all take?
(A) Children's Zoo and Lakeside Water Park.
(B) Children's Zoo and East Woods Nature Hike.
(C) Lakeside Water Park and Cloud Lake National Park.
(D) East Woods Nature Hike and Cloud Lake National Park.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q27. The Nortons love water sports. How much will it cost the whole family to play there for one afternoon?
(A) It will cost $12.
(B) It will cost $18.
(C) It will cost $21.
(D) It will cost $24.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q28. The term "lunch provided" means ______.
(A) the lunch is very delicious
(B) the cost of the lunch is included in the ticket
(C) lunch will be served in a fancy restaurant
(D) lunch will be given depending on the situation
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q29. Which of the following best describes the principal's feelings?
(A) Creative.
(B) Indecisive.
(C) Merciful.
(D) Serious.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q30. According to the notice, if a student has stolen something, he should ______.
(A) go to the police immediately
(B) go to the principal at once
(C) go to church as soon as possible
(D) go to their parents without delay
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q31. What would be a good title for this passage?
(A) Cows Killed by Owner
(B) Cows Produce Less Milk during Storms
(C) Lightning Causes Dairy Cow Deaths
(D) Summer Thunderstorms in Denmark
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q32. What does "you can't cry over spilt milk" mean?
(A) We should prevent tragedies before they happen.
(B) The dairy business is full of tragedies.
(C) Nothing can be done to prevent tragedies.
(D) When you are sad, a glass of milk will cheer you up.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q33. What can we learn from the passage?
(A) One should not go outside during summer.
(B) Dairy farmers do not take good care of their animals.
(C) It is best to avoid visiting Denmark in summer.
(D) People and animals should take proper shelter during storms.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q34. Who wrote this notice?
(A) Residents of Phoenix Community.
(B) Truck drivers.
(C) Riverdale Garbage Management.
(D) Social workers.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q35. Which of the following evenings will garbage NOT be collected?
(A) On Monday evening.
(B) On Wednesday evening.
(C) On Friday evening.
(D) On Saturday evening.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q36. How many stops do the garbage collectors make in Riverdale?
(A) They make one stop.
(B) They make two stops.
(C) They make three stops.
(D) The notice does not say.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q37. According to the notice, what time does garbage collection begin?
(A) It begins before 7:00.
(B) It begins about 8:00.
(C) It begins about 8:30.
(D) It begins after 9:00.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q38. What is the main reason Jim wrote this e-mail?
(A) To advise Ernst of Marsha's new position.
(B) To advise Ernst of a new deadline.
(C) To complain to Ernst about his work.
(D) To complain to Ernst about a raise.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q39. Who, most likely, is Mike?
(A) He is Anderson's boss.
(B) He is Jim's boss.
(C) He is Marsha's husband.
(D) He is Ernst's employee.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q40. When is the new deadline?
(A) It is on September 22.
(B) It is on October 9.
(C) It is on October 22.
(D) It is on October 23.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第2回

 
Q1. ______ between friends or colleagues should be resolved, not ignored.

(A) Compliments
(B) Comforts
(C) Conflicts
(D) Connections
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Kevin is ______ now because he broke the living room window again.

(A) in control
(B) in trouble
(C) in return
(D) in vain
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q3. Cars in the future will be characterized by their ______ use of gasoline.

(A) effective
(B) efficient
(C) immediate
(D) traditional
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q4. The man was accused ______ the bank, but the police couldn't find any evidence against him.

(A) of robbing
(B) with robbing
(C) to rob
(D) to have robbed
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q5. Your knowledge of ancient Chinese history is greater than a ______.

(A) scholar
(B) scholar's
(C) scholar is
(D) scholar does
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q6. We walked on tiptoe ______ we might wake up our sleeping parents.

(A) for fear that
(B) except that
(C) in the hope that
(D) so that
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q7. We are planning to go ______ an expedition to the Sahara to study wildlife.

(A) on
(B) at
(C) in
(D) with
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q8. While I ______ with my wife last night, an old friend of ours called.

(A) was talking
(B) had talked
(C) talked
(D) would talk
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q9. I'm sure the dense fog will have cleared away ______ day breaks.

(A) by the time
(B) at a time
(C) though
(D) since
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q10. I asked my neighbor if he would mind ______ down the radio a little.

(A) turn
(B) turning
(C) to turn
(D) having turn
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q11. He is better than me not only at English ______ at German as well.

(A) but
(B) as
(C) and
(D) also
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q12. Jane and Sue are twins, but they seem to have nothing ______.

(A) in common
(B) in comparison
(C) in contact
(D) in contrast
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q13. The boy is really smart－it seems there is hardly ______ he cannot do.

(A) everything
(B) something
(C) nothing
(D) anything
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q14. In 1958, Marian Anderson ______ as a delegate to the United Nations.

(A) served
(B) appointed
(C) did
(D) chose
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q15. How come ______ so pessimistic about life? Can't you change your attitude?

(A) are you
(B) you are
(C) that are you
(D) that you are
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
        My mother is a great woman. She always tries to teach me new things. When I was in junior high, she took me to a beauty _(16)_ so I could have my hair _(17)_.
　　Junior high school girls do not look very attractive because they usually have to _(18)_ the same hairstyle and no makeup. During the summer vacation before ninth grade, my mother took me to a beauty parlor to teach me about hairstyles and makeup. I'll never forget that experience.
　　First, the woman washed my hair very well and then dried it. She then cut my hair. After trimming it into a really cool style, she washed it again. I _(19)_ like a queen!
　　My mother wanted me to experience something new. In the future, I will understand more about how women make themselves beautiful. Because of this knowledge, I will be better able to _(20)_ into society.
 
Q16. (A) sailor
(B) janitor
(C) miser
(D) parlor
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        My mother is a great woman. She always tries to teach me new things. When I was in junior high, she took me to a beauty _(16)_ so I could have my hair _(17)_.
　　Junior high school girls do not look very attractive because they usually have to _(18)_ the same hairstyle and no makeup. During the summer vacation before ninth grade, my mother took me to a beauty parlor to teach me about hairstyles and makeup. I'll never forget that experience.
　　First, the woman washed my hair very well and then dried it. She then cut my hair. After trimming it into a really cool style, she washed it again. I _(19)_ like a queen!
　　My mother wanted me to experience something new. In the future, I will understand more about how women make themselves beautiful. Because of this knowledge, I will be better able to _(20)_ into society.
 
Q17. (A) do
(B) to do
(C) done
(D) doing
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        My mother is a great woman. She always tries to teach me new things. When I was in junior high, she took me to a beauty _(16)_ so I could have my hair _(17)_.
　　Junior high school girls do not look very attractive because they usually have to _(18)_ the same hairstyle and no makeup. During the summer vacation before ninth grade, my mother took me to a beauty parlor to teach me about hairstyles and makeup. I'll never forget that experience.
　　First, the woman washed my hair very well and then dried it. She then cut my hair. After trimming it into a really cool style, she washed it again. I _(19)_ like a queen!
　　My mother wanted me to experience something new. In the future, I will understand more about how women make themselves beautiful. Because of this knowledge, I will be better able to _(20)_ into society.
 
Q18. (A) wear
(B) leave
(C) make
(D) treat
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        My mother is a great woman. She always tries to teach me new things. When I was in junior high, she took me to a beauty _(16)_ so I could have my hair _(17)_.
　　Junior high school girls do not look very attractive because they usually have to _(18)_ the same hairstyle and no makeup. During the summer vacation before ninth grade, my mother took me to a beauty parlor to teach me about hairstyles and makeup. I'll never forget that experience.
　　First, the woman washed my hair very well and then dried it. She then cut my hair. After trimming it into a really cool style, she washed it again. I _(19)_ like a queen!
　　My mother wanted me to experience something new. In the future, I will understand more about how women make themselves beautiful. Because of this knowledge, I will be better able to _(20)_ into society.
 
Q19. (A) fell
(B) felt
(C) felled
(D) fall
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        My mother is a great woman. She always tries to teach me new things. When I was in junior high, she took me to a beauty _(16)_ so I could have my hair _(17)_.
　　Junior high school girls do not look very attractive because they usually have to _(18)_ the same hairstyle and no makeup. During the summer vacation before ninth grade, my mother took me to a beauty parlor to teach me about hairstyles and makeup. I'll never forget that experience.
　　First, the woman washed my hair very well and then dried it. She then cut my hair. After trimming it into a really cool style, she washed it again. I _(19)_ like a queen!
　　My mother wanted me to experience something new. In the future, I will understand more about how women make themselves beautiful. Because of this knowledge, I will be better able to _(20)_ into society.
 
Q20. (A) mix
(B) set
(C) beat
(D) fit
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Egypt is a mysterious land whose ancient structures still remain among the wonders of the world. Hardly _(21)_ has not heard of them or seen them in pictures. The greatest pyramid ever built is called Cheops, named _(22)_ the king who ordered it built in 2900 B.C. _(23)_ more than 140 meters above the desert sand, the Great Pyramid of Cheops is joined by two smaller but still impressive pyramids. In addition, the Great Sphinx, a rock statue of a lion's body with a man's head, _(24)_ to stand guard over the three great pyramids. These great monuments were built at a time when other cultures were _(25)_ less developed by comparison.
 
Q21. (A) anyone
(B) someone
(C) everyone
(D) no one
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Egypt is a mysterious land whose ancient structures still remain among the wonders of the world. Hardly _(21)_ has not heard of them or seen them in pictures. The greatest pyramid ever built is called Cheops, named _(22)_ the king who ordered it built in 2900 B.C. _(23)_ more than 140 meters above the desert sand, the Great Pyramid of Cheops is joined by two smaller but still impressive pyramids. In addition, the Great Sphinx, a rock statue of a lion's body with a man's head, _(24)_ to stand guard over the three great pyramids. These great monuments were built at a time when other cultures were _(25)_ less developed by comparison.

(B) to
(C) for
(D) after

(C) Two pairs of shoes and a party dress.
(D) Two pairs of jeans and two pairs of shoes.

(B) It is the world's heaviest fish.

(D) It is an endangered species.

(B) He is Melissa's son.

(D) He is Phyllis's son.

(A) She lives in the U.S.
(B) She lives in France.
(C) She lives in the U.K.
(D) She lives in Taiwan.

試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第3回

 
Q1. Jake was very disappointed ______ hearing that he hadn't passed the exam.

(A) during
(B) over
(C) upon
(D) in
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q2. No one can possibly know ______ when an earthquake will strike.

(A) in vain
(B) in return
(C) in particular
(D) in advance
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q3. I don't like his attitude ______ life. He is a little too pessimistic.

(A) of
(B) at
(C) toward
(D) for
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q4. She didn't show up yesterday, ____ be able to come tomorrow.

(A) nor she will
(B) nor she does
(C) nor will she
(D) nor does she
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q5. I will go home for vacation as soon as I ______ my exams.

(A) will finish
(B) finish
(C) am finishing
(D) finished
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q6. They started a campaign to ______ funds for charity.

(A) raise
(B) arouse
(C) rise
(D) arise
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q7. Walking away quickly, the man in question refused to ______ the sex scandal.

(A) comment on
(B) call for
(C) carry out
(D) depend on
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q8. All the students will have to attend the weekly meeting, John ______.

(A) included
(B) including
(C) inclusive
(D) is included
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q9. It never ______ to me that John could speak English so well.

(A) occurred
(B) happened
(C) struck
(D) took place
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q10. His plan ______ to be a failure because of lack of cash.

(A) turned out
(B) turned up
(C) brought up
(D) brought about
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

(A) gave up
(B) had given up
(C) will give up
(D) has given up
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q12. Do you think that Teresa offended you and your family ______?

(A) friendly
(B) gradually
(C) intentionally
(D) permanently
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q13. He is a man of his word, so what he says really ______.

(A) counts
(B) is counted
(C) accounts
(D) is accounted
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q14. David's death was a great blow to Jane, and it took her a long time to ______ the grief.

(A) put out
(B) come across
(C) take in
(D) get over
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q15. After hiking all day, the students sat down by the stream to quench their ______.

(A) hunger
(B) energy
(C) thirst
(D) nutrition
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
        Last week, our Social Work Club at school did a really good thing. We made cookies, cakes, and sandwiches and sold them in our school gymnasium. All the money _(16)_ from the sale was given to children who do not have parents. Their school needed a new TV, and the NT$22,000 we earned from the sale _(17)_ them buy a new one.
　　Some of the club members went to the school to deliver the money. We played with the children all day. They were so happy to see us. We played games and helped them with their math and Chinese. Seeing how _(18)_ they were really touched my heart.
　　My father used to tell me, "To give is better than to receive." I never really understood that _(19)_ last week. Helping others makes us feel important and meaningful. I'm looking _(20)_ to our next club activity!
 
Q16. (A) earned
(B) earning
(C) earns
(D) earn
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Last week, our Social Work Club at school did a really good thing. We made cookies, cakes, and sandwiches and sold them in our school gymnasium. All the money _(16)_ from the sale was given to children who do not have parents. Their school needed a new TV, and the NT$22,000 we earned from the sale _(17)_ them buy a new one.
　　Some of the club members went to the school to deliver the money. We played with the children all day. They were so happy to see us. We played games and helped them with their math and Chinese. Seeing how _(18)_ they were really touched my heart.
　　My father used to tell me, "To give is better than to receive." I never really understood that _(19)_ last week. Helping others makes us feel important and meaningful. I'm looking _(20)_ to our next club activity!

(B) got
(C) enabled
(D) helped

(B) until
(C) on
(D) in

試題解說

[文章中譯]

Q20. (A) up
(B) ahead
(C) down
(D) forward
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Do you believe in ghosts? Most people are afraid of them, but everyone is interested in them. A recent story I read in the newspaper made me think about _(21)_ ghosts really exist or not.
　　Four men in mainland China found a one-thousand-year-old grave and decided to rob it. They dug down into the grave, _(22)_ when they reached the bottom, an old wall _(23)_ the grave fell down, killing three of them. The fourth man ran to the police to tell them _(24)_ had happened.
　　When I read the story, I thought, "Did the ghost of the grave punish the men for disturbing him?" It made me feel _(25)_. Maybe there are ghosts, and they live a long time, protecting their graves!
 
Q21. (A) how
(B) when
(C) whether
(D) where
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Do you believe in ghosts? Most people are afraid of them, but everyone is interested in them. A recent story I read in the newspaper made me think about _(21)_ ghosts really exist or not.
　　Four men in mainland China found a one-thousand-year-old grave and decided to rob it. They dug down into the grave, _(22)_ when they reached the bottom, an old wall _(23)_ the grave fell down, killing three of them. The fourth man ran to the police to tell them _(24)_ had happened.
　　When I read the story, I thought, "Did the ghost of the grave punish the men for disturbing him?" It made me feel _(25)_. Maybe there are ghosts, and they live a long time, protecting their graves!

(B) but
(C) so
(D) though
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Do you believe in ghosts? Most people are afraid of them, but everyone is interested in them. A recent story I read in the newspaper made me think about _(21)_ ghosts really exist or not.

Q29. Where is this notice probably posted?
(A) At the Health Department.
(B) At foreign health departments.
(C) In health officials' homes.
(D) At Taiwan's international airports.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q30. What should foreigners do if they feel sick when in Taiwan?
(A) Call a hotline number.
(B) Arrive in Taiwan.
(C) Leave Taiwan immediately.
(D) Fill out a yellow card.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q31. What foreign life forms are welcome in Taiwan?
(A) Fire ants.
(B) Fruits and vegetables.
(C) Crop damage.
(D) Suitcases and backpacks.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q32. Where do fire ants originally come from?
(A) Taiwan's farms.
(B) The U.S. states.
(C) Suitcases and backpacks.
(D) South America.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q33. What is the problem with fire ants?
(A) They do not like fruits and vegetables.
(B) They come from other countries.
(C) They destroy crops.
(D) They control the government.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q34. What is no longer safe in Newtown?
(A) Newtown Central Park.
(B) Newtown City Police Department.
(C) The Police Department hotline number.
(D) The citizens of Newtown.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q35. For which of the following reasons is this warning issued?
(A) Crime in Newtown Central Park.
(B) The emergency hotline number.
(C) The low number of cellphones.
(D) Citizens protecting themselves.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q36. Who is causing the problem?
(A) The Newtown City Police Department.
(B) Criminals and street gangs.
(C) The Newtown Telephone Company.
(D) The citizens of Newtown.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q37. Where would this warning notice most likely be posted?
(A) In supermarkets.
(B) In department stores.
(C) In Newtown Central Park.
(D) In the Newtown Telephone Company.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

(A) August 2nd.
(B) August 10th.
(C) August 11th.
(D) August 12th.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

(A) A kind of drink.
(B) A kind of snack food.
(C) A kind of viewing instrument.
(D) A kind of meteor.

試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q40. What is unusual about August?
(A) The nights are cool.
(B) It has an astronomy party.
(C) One can see stars.
(D) Time flies in August.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第4回

 
Q1. Your idea, although it sounds quite workable, needs ______ out first.

(A) try
(B) to try
(C) trying
(D) being tried
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q2. John is able to concentrate no matter when and where he is ______ work.

(A) on
(B) in
(C) at
(D) over
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q3. The outdoor concert was to be ____ because of the incoming typhoon.

(A) put off
(B) put out
(C) put up
(D) put away
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q4. I'm very confident that the committee ______ a conclusion by the end of this month.

(A) will have reached
(B) may have reached
(C) should have reached
(D) can have reached
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q5. He burst into tears ______ he heard that his wife had died in the car accident.

(A) as far as
(B) as long as
(C) as well as
(D) as soon as
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q6. I don't like John because he can't help ______ ill of others.

(A) talking
(B) speaking
(C) saying
(D) telling
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q7. The artist is famous for his genius and great ______.

(A) fragrance
(B) originality
(C) survival
(D) therapy
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q8. ______ I had money two years ago, I would have bought that apartment immediately.

(A) When
(B) If
(C) Though
(D) Had
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q9. I like everything about the apartment ______ the rent.

(A) It's too high.as for
(B) except for
(C) instead of
(D) in place of
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q10. On the floor ______ with a few toys in front of her.

(A) sat a girl
(B) did a girl sit
(C) sit a girl
(D) sitting a girl
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q11. Our sales ______ for months, so we are in great financial difficulty now.

(A) have been dropping
(B) have been dropped
(C) are dropping
(D) are being dropped
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q12. Many measures are taken ______ minimize the damage caused by the typhoon.

(A) due to
(B) with a view to
(C) in order to
(D) so as that
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q13. Chinese parents are very ______ of their children, especially when their kids are very young.

(A) persistent
(B) peculiar
(C) protective
(D) persuasive
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q14. The pitcher can still play, ______ the coach wants to find a substitute.

(A) and
(B) but
(C) so
(D) or
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q15. Even though the thief denied _____the money, the policeman had found lots of evidence against him.

(A) stealing
(B) to steal
(C) to have stolen
(D) stole
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
        Yesterday, I woke up a little late, so I was in a rush to get to school. I got dressed quickly, _(16)_ breakfast, and ran out of the house to catch a bus. Luckily, I just _(17)_ it to school. I was hungry, but at least I wasn't late.
　　That was the only good news for me. When I got home, I realized I had forgotten to take my keys with me. My parents were still _(18)_ work, and I didn't have any way to get into my own house. I had also forgotten my money, so I couldn't go into a coffee shop to kill _(19)_. When my parents got home, I was standing in front of the house. They scolded me for being so careless! I learned that it's best to _(20)_ a little early each night so I can wake up on time in the morning.
 
Q16. (A) jumped
(B) skipped
(C) climbed
(D) hopped
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Yesterday, I woke up a little late, so I was in a rush to get to school. I got dressed quickly, _(16)_ breakfast, and ran out of the house to catch a bus. Luckily, I just _(17)_ it to school. I was hungry, but at least I wasn't late.
　　That was the only good news for me. When I got home, I realized I had forgotten to take my keys with me. My parents were still _(18)_ work, and I didn't have any way to get into my own house. I had also forgotten my money, so I couldn't go into a coffee shop to kill _(19)_. When my parents got home, I was standing in front of the house. They scolded me for being so careless! I learned that it's best to _(20)_ a little early each night so I can wake up on time in the morning.

(B) made
(C) got
(D) had
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

I learned that it's best to _(20)_ a little early each night so I can wake up on time in the morning.

(B) with
(C) in
(D) at
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

I learned that it's best to _(20)_ a little early each night so I can wake up on time in the morning.

(B) minutes
(C) seconds
(D) moments
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

I had also forgotten my money, so I couldn't go into a coffee shop to kill _(19)_. When my parents got home, I was standing in front of the house. They scolded me for being so careless! I learned that it's best to _(20)_ a little early each night so I can wake up on time in the morning.
 
Q20. (A) turn in
(B) turn down
(C) turn up
(D) turn out
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Have you ever heard the English expression, "as busy as a bee"? _(21)_, honeybees are very good workers. They fly all day from flower to flower to collect the pollen they need to make honey. Then they fly back to their _(22)_ to deliver their precious pollen and get a much-needed night's sleep. Sometimes, _(23)_, bees do not have time to get back home. What happens then?
　　Honeybees find the bottom of a leaf to sleep under through the night. If the weather is too cold, though, they may _(24)_ to death. They might also be unable to fly away from birds that like to eat them. It's a good idea for bees to get home in time _(25)_ dinner!
 
Q21. (A) In fact
(B) In length
(C) In detail
(D) In total
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Have you ever heard the English expression, "as busy as a bee"? _(21)_, honeybees are very good workers. They fly all day from flower to flower to collect the pollen they need to make honey. Then they fly back to their _(22)_ to deliver their precious pollen and get a much-needed night's sleep. Sometimes, _(23)_, bees do not have time to get back home. What happens then?
　　Honeybees find the bottom of a leaf to sleep under through the night. If the weather is too cold, though, they may _(24)_ to death. They might also be unable to fly away from birds that like to eat them. It's a good idea for bees to get home in time _(25)_ dinner!

(B) tide
(C) kite

閱讀 第5回

 
Q1. The Chairman proposed that the meeting ______ until next Friday because a typhoon was approaching.

(A) must put off
(B) must be put off
(C) put off
(D) be put off
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q2. It is impossible to get John to change his mind. He is very ______.

(A) tame
(B) flexible
(C) stubborn
(D) conducive
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q3. ______ about the future of his son, who does nothing but play around, Mr. Wolfe has determined to send him to the military.

(A) Worry
(B) Worried
(C) To worry
(D) To be worried
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q4. It was with teamwork ______ we defeated the visiting team.

(A) that
(B) which
(C) through which
(D) in which
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q5. My father is really demanding. I'm afraid I can't ______ his expectations.

(A) get
(B) meet
(C) have
(D) succeed
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q6. With the outbreak of SARS, how to control this highly contagious disease has become a major _____ in Taiwan.

(A) affair
(B) doubt
(C) obstacle
(D) concern
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q7. I had hardly entered the room ____ the phone rang. But when I picked it up, there was no response.

(A) when
(B) then
(C) and
(D) for
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q8. I know it was John's first time to be here, but he insisted that he ______ here four years before.

(A) came
(B) come
(C) had come
(D) should come
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q9. ______ 150 people were killed in an aircrash that took place in Nigeria, including all crew members on board.

(A) Estimate
(B) Estimated
(C) An estimate of
(D) An estimated
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q10. The two high school students' funny performance on the crosswalk ____ the attention of all passersby.

(A) made
(B) paid
(C) offered
(D) drew
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q11. The speaker couldn't make himself ______ because there was too much traffic nearby.

(A) hear
(B) hearing
(C) heard
(D) to hear
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q12. Over the past 40 years, Mr. Wilson has taught thousands of students, some of them ______ internationally known scholars.

(A) have become
(B) had become
(C) having become
(D) may have become
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q13. The guest's speech was too long and too boring. He should have made it shorter and more to the ______.

(A) point
(B) end
(C) tip
(D) top
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q14. John's parents worried about his health and got him ______ smoking and drinking right away.

(A) quit
(B) to quit
(C) quitting
(D) quitted
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q15. Frankly speaking, ______ your timely help, I couldn't have dealt with that problem all by myself.

(A) if it were not for
(B) if it had not been for
(C) if there were not for
(D) if there had not been for
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
        According to scientists, frogs are disappearing from the earth. Since 1997, the frog population has dropped _(16)_ 2 percent every year. Some frog species have completely_(17)_. No one can be sure why this is happening, but a number of scientists are looking into it. Joe Pechmann, a professor at the University of New Orleans, has been studying frogs for 18 years. He believes there are several stresses on our planet that are killing off frogs. These problems _(18)_ pollution, global warming and loss of the frog habitat due to human population growth. Pechmann warns the loss of frogs should be taken seriously. "It makes sense in theory that what happens to frogs will happen to us," he said. Even if we aren't at _(19)_, we may have to take _(20)_ for the extinction of frog species that have managed to survive for millions of years before man.
 
Q16. (A) at
(B) for
(C) with
(D) by
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        According to scientists, frogs are disappearing from the earth. Since 1997, the frog population has dropped _(16)_ 2 percent every year. Some frog species have completely_(17)_. No one can be sure why this is happening, but a number of scientists are looking into it. Joe Pechmann, a professor at the University of New Orleans, has been studying frogs for 18 years. He believes there are several stresses on our planet that are killing off frogs. These problems _(18)_ pollution, global warming and loss of the frog habitat due to human population growth. Pechmann warns the loss of frogs should be taken seriously. "It makes sense in theory that what happens to frogs will happen to us," he said. Even if we aren't at _(19)_, we may have to take _(20)_ for the extinction of frog species that have managed to survive for millions of years before man.
 
Q17. (A) vanished
(B) finished
(C) steamed
(D) crashed
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        According to scientists, frogs are disappearing from the earth. Since 1997, the frog population has dropped _(16)_ 2 percent every year. Some frog species have completely_(17)_. No one can be sure why this is happening, but a number of scientists are looking into it. Joe Pechmann, a professor at the University of New Orleans, has been studying frogs for 18 years. He believes there are several stresses on our planet that are killing off frogs. These problems _(18)_ pollution, global warming and loss of the frog habitat due to human population growth. Pechmann warns the loss of frogs should be taken seriously. "It makes sense in theory that what happens to frogs will happen to us," he said. Even if we aren't at _(19)_, we may have to take _(20)_ for the extinction of frog species that have managed to survive for millions of years before man.

(B) included
(C) inclusive
(D) include
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

(B) danger
(C) risk
(D) adventure

試題解說

[文章中譯]

Even if we aren't at _(19)_, we may have to take _(20)_ for the extinction of frog species that have managed to survive for millions of years before man.
 
Q20. (A) blame
(B) responsibility
(C) stress
(D) honor
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Airplanes, heights and spiders are things that many people fear. However, if the thought of speaking in public makes you ill, then you are not _(21)_. Surveys show that public speaking is the number one fear for most people. However, there are _(22)_ things you can do to reduce your anxieties.
　　First, be well prepared and know your subject, making sure you're familiar with the topic you're supposed to talk about. Next, practice beforehand. Saying something out loud will help you remember what you have to say. Lastly, you can _(23)_ a course in public speaking.Toastmasters is an international group which helps people _(24)_ their fear of speaking in public. If all else fails, remember the _(25)_ advice. Imagine that everyone in the audience is naked. This way, you will feel less embarrassed.
 
Q21. (A) lonely
(B) lone
(C) alone
(D) lonesome
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

(D) He can bring one friend and pay NT$500.

(B) Acupressure cannot help sick people get well.

(A) It stimulates one's imagination.
(B) It makes the body malfunction.
(C) It opens up blockages.

(A) to get rid of
(B) to attend to
(C) to make up for
(D) to team up

試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第6回

 
Q1. John has been living in London for almost twenty years, so we take it for ______ that he speaks very good English.

(A) true
(B) granted
(C) sure
(D) permitted
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Tommy is a bit spoiled, ______ is often the case with an only child.

(A) it
(B) that
(C) this
(D) as
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q3. It is reported that many people in that area have died from drinking _____ water.

(A) contaminated
(B) numerous
(C) visible
(D) recognized
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q4. All companies welcome ______ employees because they do their jobs well and successfully without wasting time or energy.

(A) reluctant
(B) sufficient
(C) greedy
(D) efficient
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q5. To annoy me, my little brother ______ turned up the radio while I was studying.

(A) deliberately
(B) considerately
(C) precisely
(D) thankfully
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q6. The first national park of the United States, ______, was Yellowstone in the State of Wyoming.

(A) founding in 1872
(B) finding in 1872
(C) founded in 1872
(D) found
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q7. ______ had we got into the building than it began to rain cats and dogs.

(A) No sooner
(B) Hardly
(C) No faster
(D) Scarcely
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q8. You shouldn't tell lies, ______ take advantage of people you know.

(A) and you should neither
(B) neither should you
(C) or you should
(D) nor should you
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q9. I agree with you. Peter is ______ too young to handle such a heavy mission.

(A) very
(B) so
(C) much
(D) such
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q10. It is essential that everyone ______ a mask lest people should contract SARS.

(A) wear
(B) wears
(C) must wear
(D) is wearing
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q11. Much to our surprise, Sonia married ______ after she graduated from college.

(A) shortly
(B) fast
(C) early
(D) quickly
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q12. The brave soldiers will not surrender to the enemy. They ______ die than live in disgrace.

(A) might as well
(B) may well
(C) would rather
(D) will sooner
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q13. Father makes ______ to go hiking every morning, which is why he is in pretty good shape even though he's almost 80.

(A) a rule
(B) it a rule
(C) it is a rule
(D) it be a rule
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q14. I have been living alone in Taipei for a long time, but I ______ back to my hometown in Tainan every few weeks to see my parents.

(A) am going
(B) have gone
(C) will have gone
(D) go
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q15. Bear in mind that a man's dignity ______ on what he has but on what he is.

(A) is not depended
(B) not depends
(C) does not depend
(D) is depended not
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
        Are you feeling tired? Are you often sick? Maybe it's because you are not getting enough Vitamin C. Scientists have reported that people who _(16)_ high levels of Vitamin C live six years longer than those with lower levels of Vitamin C. Some athletes strongly believe in the powers of Vitamin C. They often _(17)_ 100 times the recommended daily amount. However, there is no solid research that shows _(18)_ positive effect from doing so. In fact, an overdose in Vitamin C may lead to weakness and stomach pains.
　　Vitamin C can be easily obtained from food. Citrus fruits and green vegetables are high _(19)_ Vitamin C. Lack of Vitamin C in a diet can lead to a higher risk of illness, fatigue and depression. Obtaining your dosage from fresh food is the best _(20)_, but sometimes it might be necessary to take a vitamin pill in order to stay healthy.
 
Q16. (A) assume
(B) presume
(C) resume
(D) consume
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Are you feeling tired? Are you often sick? Maybe it's because you are not getting enough Vitamin C. Scientists have reported that people who _(16)_ high levels of Vitamin C live six years longer than those with lower levels of Vitamin C. Some athletes strongly believe in the powers of Vitamin C. They often _(17)_ 100 times the recommended daily amount. However, there is no solid research that shows _(18)_ positive effect from doing so. In fact, an overdose in Vitamin C may lead to weakness and stomach pains.
　　Vitamin C can be easily obtained from food. Citrus fruits and green vegetables are high _(19)_ Vitamin C. Lack of Vitamin C in a diet can lead to a higher risk of illness, fatigue and depression. Obtaining your dosage from fresh food is the best _(20)_, but sometimes it might be necessary to take a vitamin pill in order to stay healthy.
 
Q17. (A) take
(B) eat
(C) drink
(D) have
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

Obtaining your dosage from fresh food is the best _(20)_, but sometimes it might be necessary to take a vitamin pill in order to stay healthy.
 
Q18. (A) some
(B) a few
(C) any
(D) most
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C

Q19. (A) of
(B) for
(C) with
(D) in
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Are you feeling tired? Are you often sick? Maybe it's because you are not getting enough Vitamin C. 　　Vitamin C can be easily obtained from food. Citrus fruits and green vegetables are high _(19)_ Vitamin C. Lack of Vitamin C in a diet can lead to a higher risk of illness, fatigue and depression. Obtaining your dosage from fresh food is the best _(20)_, but sometimes it might be necessary to take a vitamin pill in order to stay healthy.
 
Q20. (A) target
(B) option
(C) ideal
(D) diagnosis
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        There are over 500 species of carnivorous plants that inhabit the earth. But the Venus flytrap is probably the most well-known. The Venus flytrap resides only in a small area in the United Sates, _(21)_ the climate is warm and wet. The "trap" on the plant is actually two leaves that have small spikes that look like teeth. Inside the trap _(22)_ a sweet liquid and _(23)_ hairs. When an insect touches at least two hairs within 20 seconds, the trap will close. Depending on the insect's size, it may _(24)_ several hours to weeks to digest the crature. There are very few Venus flytraps left in the wild; _(25)_, they are protected by the government. Today, the best place to see one is a flower shop.
 
Q21. (A) how
(B) where
(C) when
(D) which
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        There are over 500 species of carnivorous plants that inhabit the earth. But the Venus flytrap is probably the most well-known. The Venus flytrap resides only in a small area in the United Sates, _(21)_ the climate is warm and wet. The "trap" on the plant is actually two leaves that have small spikes that look like teeth. Inside the trap _(22)_ a sweet liquid and _(23)_ hairs. When an insect touches at least two hairs within 20 seconds, the trap will close. Depending on the insect's size, it may _(24)_ several hours to weeks to digest the crature. There are very few Venus flytraps left in the wild; _(25)_, they are protected by the government. Today, the best place to see one is a flower shop.

(B) are
(C) has
(D) is
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B

閱讀 第7回

 
Q1. Obviously it is hard work that _____ John's success today.

(A) results from
(B) abides by
(C) accounts for
(D) runs after
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Even though I've been living in the city for years, I find it hard to _____ to city life.

(A) adapt
(B) adopt
(C) accustom
(D) adept
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q3. It certainly takes lots of time and effort to learn English, but it is quite a ______ experience.

(A) grateful
(B) troublesome
(C) regretful
(D) rewarding
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q4. ______ the best of your knowledge, which of the three girls has a talent for music?

(A) By
(B) In
(C) To
(D) With
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q5. Environmentalists ______ to the construction of another nuclear power plant in Taiwan.

(A) object
(B) oppose
(C) subject
(D) offend
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q6. How can we measure what a student has accomplished if we can't teach him everything he's ______ to learn?

(A) supposed
(B) considered
(C) thought
(D) deemed

(A) has laid
(B) had lain
(C) has lied
(D) had lied

(B) by
(C) for
(D) about

(A) to
(B) on
(C) for
(D) at

Q15. I felt like ______ when I smelt that rotten egg. Tell me who left it there on the desk.

(A) to throw up
(B) throwing up
(C) to throw out
(D) throwing out
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
        Different places may have different laws. A legal act in Brazil, Korea, or France might be _(16)_ in Toronto, Miami, or San Francisco. In many cities in the United States, for instance, it is not legal to "jaywalk." This law may seem strange to visitors. Sometimes they cross a street, and a police officer gives them a ticket. Then they need to pay a _(17)_ of $10 to $25 within ten days. They soon learn to cross a street only in a crosswalk or at a corner. It's _(18)_ the law to cross in the middle of the street.
　　Most people know that states in the United States have different laws about the legal drinking age; this age _(19)_ but in most states, no one under twenty-one can buy _(20)_, even beer or wine.
 
Q16. (A) illegal
(B) tame
(C) proper
(D) stingy
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Different places may have different laws. A legal act in Brazil, Korea, or France might be _(16)_ in Toronto, Miami, or San Francisco. In many cities in the United States, for instance, it is not legal to "jaywalk." This law may seem strange to visitors. Sometimes they cross a street, and a police officer gives them a ticket. Then they need to pay a _(17)_ of $10 to $25 within ten days. They soon learn to cross a street only in a crosswalk or at a corner. It's _(18)_ the law to cross in the middle of the street.
　　Most people know that states in the United States have different laws about the legal drinking age; this age _(19)_ but in most states, no one under twenty-one can buy _(20)_, even beer or wine.

(B) fee
(C) fare
(D) fine

　　Most people know that states in the United States have different laws about the legal drinking age; this age _(19)_ but in most states, no one under twenty-one can buy _(20)_, even beer or wine.

(C) varies
(D) declines

Q20. (A) alcohol
(B) stocks
(C) property
(D) reputation
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Scientists are now studying a new field of research called psychoimmunology. It is based _(21)_ the idea that people who are depressed or have a lot of stress _(22)_ more likely to become sick. Researchers have recently found a connection between diseases and stressful situations. To test this theory, psychoimmunologists are trying to find a link between the brain and the immune system.
　　The immune system in our bodies fights the bacteria and viruses which cause disease. Therefore, _(23)_ we are likely to get various diseases or not depends on how well our immune system works. Biologists used to think that the immune system was a separate, independent part of our bodies. Recently, _(24)_, they have found that our brain can _(25)_ our immune system.
 
Q21. (A) with
(B) in
(C) on
(D) to
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Scientists are now studying a new field of research called psychoimmunology. It is based _(21)_ the idea that people who are depressed or have a lot of stress _(22)_ more likely to become sick. Researchers have recently found a connection between diseases and stressful situations. To test this theory, psychoimmunologists are trying to find a link between the brain and the immune system.
　　The immune system in our bodies fights the bacteria and viruses which cause disease. Therefore, _(23)_ we are likely to get various diseases or not depends on how well our immune system works. Biologists used to think that the immune system was a separate, independent part of our bodies. Recently, _(24)_, they have found that our brain can _(25)_ our immune system.

Q34. The word "personality" is closest in meaning to
(A) qualities of a person.
(B) a famous person.
(C) where a person works.
(D) what kind of pets people own.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q35. What can be inferred about SuperFit Gym?
(A) It is quite large.
(B) It is too busy.
(C) It's expensive.
(D) They will be sold out soon.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q36. According to this advertisement, if you get a fitness trainer, you can
(A) get a free month's membership.
(B) lose weight.
(C) gain 5 kg.
(D) win a trip to Cuba.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q37. According to this article, why did Bill Gates pursue a career in computers?
(A) He was good at math.
(B) He knew home computers were going to be popular.
(C) He didn't do well in school.
(D) He was a billionaire.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q38. The word "worth" in line 1 means
(A) reputation.
(B) company.
(C) deserving.
(D) money and value of all possessions.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q39. What was key to the success of Microsoft?
(A) The partnership with IBM.
(B) Forming BASIC software.
(C) The growth in popularity of BASIC computers.
(D) The US government.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q40. What does the author mean by "household name" mentioned in line 14?
(A) Microsoft is the name of the home of IBM.
(B) Most people know the name of Microsoft.
(C) Most houses have a Microsoft.
(D) Microsoft is not well-known.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第8回

 
Q1. A good speaker must be ______, or else his speech is likely to be boring.

(A) eloquent
(B) essential
(C) innocent
(D) monotonous
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Instead of withdrawing into a corner, you should ______ your courage and meet all the challenges that lie ahead.

(A) cheer up
(B) pluck up
(C) make up
(D) set up
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q3. The man ______ to the police officer that he had broken into the house and stolen all the moeny.

(A) confessed
(B) captured
(C) complied
(D) convicted
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q4. The ______ Mary has of that young man is that of a very kind and polite person.

(A) aspect
(B) idea
(C) image
(D) operation
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q5. Intelligence does not ______ mean success. You need diligence as well.

(A) necessarily
(B) formally
(C) similarly
(D) originally
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q6. No doubt you would like to know how I have been getting along ______ I left school.

(A) after
(B) before
(C) once
(D) since
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q7. Over the past 20 years, basketball ______ more popular than baseball in that country.

(A) had become
(B) became
(C) has become
(D) will have come
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q8. Mrs. Wilson would surely have punished Peter ______ out that he didn't hand in his assignment.

(A) if she found
(B) should she find
(C) had she found
(D) if she has found
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q9. Who is that girl ______ by the window? She is really a stunning beauty.

(A) sits
(B) sat
(C) set
(D) seated

(A) tell
(B) convince
(C) persuade
(D) talk

(A) not deny
(B) no deny
(C) no denying
(D) not denying
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q12. Traffic here is so chaotic that you ______ be too careful when crossing the street.

(A) must not
(B) should not
(C) cannot
(D) may not
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q13. I was in such a hurry that I forgot to say goodbye to the friends ______ I had worked for so many years.

(A) with whom
(B) with them
(C) whom
(D) whose
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q14. Mr. Robertson has thirty grandchildren in all. He loves everyone of them, Johnny ______.

(A) in especial
(B) in unique
(C) in particular
(D) in special
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q15. All my friends, Peter ______, are fond of music and can play different musical instruments, so I've decided to form a band with them.

(A) included
(B) including
(C) to include
(D) inclusive
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
        There are few of us who haven't heard of Hans Chritstian Anderson. He was a children's writer from Denmark _(16)_ stories are famous around the world. , and are just a few to _(17)_. Hans Christian Anderson's stories are known _(18)_ their adult themes. He wanted to teach children and people about the consequences of their actions. He had a very difficult childhood because his father died when he was just a little boy. Young Hans had to work in a factory to support his family. He was a very shy boy who didn't have many friends but loved to _(19)_ stories. He felt like the ugly little duckling in his story because he wasn't a very handsome man and he never got married. He didn't turn into a beautiful swan as the ugly duckling did. But his stories are an _(20)_ to everyone who reads them.
 
Q16. (A) whose
(B) its
(C) which
(D) his
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        There are few of us who haven't heard of Hans Chritstian Anderson. He was a children's writer from Denmark _(16)_ stories are famous around the world. , and are just a few to _(17)_. Hans Christian Anderson's stories are known _(18)_ their adult themes. He wanted to teach children and people about the consequences of their actions. He had a very difficult childhood because his father died when he was just a little boy. Young Hans had to work in a factory to support his family. He was a very shy boy who didn't have many friends but loved to _(19)_ stories. He felt like the ugly little duckling in his story because he wasn't a very handsome man and he never got married. He didn't turn into a beautiful swan as the ugly duckling did. But his stories are an _(20)_ to everyone who reads them.

(B) present
(C) say
(D) name
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

(B) as

答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

(C) make up

(B) inspiration
(C) perspiration
(D) aspiration
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Many people are fascinated by Egypt because of its ancient culture and mysterious pyramids. Egypt is a country _(21)_ in North Africa and it has the longest river in the world, the Nile. People like to travel to this beautiful and exotic land because they want to see the tombs of the ancient Egyptian kings. Many scientists and _(22)_ have tried to discover the secrets of the pyramids but so far no one has been successful. The most famous one is the Pyramid of Giza.
　　The ancient Egyptians had a special style of writing called hieroglyphics. We learn about their culture from the messages they _(23)_. Nowadays, explorers search the desert sands _(24)_ to find an undiscovered tomb _(25)_ with gold and treasures.
 
Q21. (A) inhabited
(B) located
(C) resided
(D) lied
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Many people are fascinated by Egypt because of its ancient culture and mysterious pyramids. Egypt is a country _(21)_ in North Africa and it has the longest river in the world, the Nile. People like to travel to this beautiful and exotic land because they want to see the tombs of the ancient Egyptian kings. Many scientists and _(22)_ have tried to discover the secrets of the pyramids but so far no one has been successful. The most famous one is the Pyramid of Giza.
　　The ancient Egyptians had a special style of writing called hieroglyphics. We learn about their culture from the messages they _(23)_. Nowadays, explorers search the desert sands _(24)_ to find an undiscovered tomb _(25)_ with gold and treasures.

(B) peddlers
(C) customers
(D) missionaries

試題解說

(A) They make new friends.
(B) They may go back to their own country.

(D) They adapt to the new country.

(B) During stage two.
(C) During stage three.

試題解說

閱讀 第9回

 
Q1. I don't trust Peter because what he does hardly ever ______ what he says.

(A) results in
(B) gets along with
(C) corresponds to
(D) abides by
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Should you hit someone accidentally, you must ______ to him or her without hesitation.

(A) deny
(B) apologize
(C) surrender
(D) contain
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q3. The merciless mother doesn't seem to have any ______ for her little daughter.

(A) affection
(B) confession
(C) intention
(D) reservation
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q4. The criminal was ______ to twenty years in prison for robbing a bank.

(A) accused
(B) charged
(C) sentenced
(D) convicted
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q5. We tried very hard to persuade that stubborn old man to change his mind, but ______.

(A) at will
(B) on purpose
(C) in vain
(D) to capacity
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q6. I was about to leave ______ John, an old friend of mine I hadn't seen in ages, called.

(A) that
(B) when
(C) then
(D) while
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q7. By the time he retires, Professor Johnson ______ here for over thirty years, but his classes are never dull.

(A) has taught
(B) will have taught
(C) will teach
(D) has been teaching
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q8. I will marry you on ______ that you promise not to cheat on me all your life.

(A) principle
(B) ground
(C) condition
(D) guarantee
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q9. I wish I ______ you were here yesterday, or else I would have come to see you.

(A) know
(B) knew
(C) have known
(D) had known
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q10. The boy ______ the tree, but was not punished by his father because of his honesty.

(A) felt
(B) fell
(C) felled
(D) fallen
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q11. With so much work to do, I don't think I'll be able to come to your party tonight, but I'll certainly invite you to dinner ______ next week.

(A) sometime
(B) some time
(C) sometimes
(D) some times
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q12. When John woke up, it was already 7:30, so he decided to take a taxi lest he ______ late.

(A) might be
(B) could be
(C) be
(D) must be
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q13. ______ you want to give your family a nice, wholesome vacation, try visiting this charming town.

(A) Where
(B) What
(C) If
(D) That
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q14. Bill still came to school for the final exams ______ he had a very high fever.

(A) in spite of that
(B) even
(C) in that
(D) despite the fact that
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q15. You may give this prize to anyone ______ you think is the best.

(A) whom
(B) who
(C) what
(D) which
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
        What is the best way to meet the person of your dreams? Today, more and more people are _(16)_ their mate online. _(17)_ was once considered an unusual method of meeting is now quite normal.
　　Companies _(18)_ dating services claim online dating is easy, safe and cheap. Each person posts detailed information about themselves. This can include hobbies, education, dislikes and, of course, what they are looking for in a mate. Furthermore, most people will put a picture online. This is much more _(19)_ than the newspaper since those ads are often quite short and never include a photo. But buyers, _(20)_! Some people are not what they claim to be. The police have reported several cases where older men claimed to be teenagers and have tricked unsuspecting girls. Some people have found their love of their life. Still, as yet, most people haven't had too much luck.
 
Q16. (A) seeking for
(B) searching into
(C) seeking
(D) searching
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        What is the best way to meet the person of your dreams? Today, more and more people are _(16)_ their mate online. _(17)_ was once considered an unusual method of meeting is now quite normal.
　　Companies _(18)_ dating services claim online dating is easy, safe and cheap. Each person posts detailed information about themselves. This can include hobbies, education, dislikes and, of course, what they are looking for in a mate. Furthermore, most people will put a picture online. This is much more _(19)_ than the newspaper since those ads are often quite short and never include a photo. But buyers, _(20)_! Some people are not what they claim to be. The police have reported several cases where older men claimed to be teenagers and have tricked unsuspecting girls. Some people have found their love of their life. Still, as yet, most people haven't had too much luck.

(B) How
(C) What
(D) Which
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

試題解說

[文章中譯]

試題解說

[文章中譯]

        What is the best way to meet the person of your dreams? Today, more and more people are _(16)_ their mate online. _(17)_ was once considered an unusual method of meeting is now quite normal.
　　Companies _(18)_ dating services claim online dating is easy, safe and cheap. Each person posts detailed information about themselves. This can include hobbies, education, dislikes and, of course, what they are looking for in a mate. Furthermore, most people will put a picture online. This is much more _(19)_ than the newspaper since those ads are often quite short and never include a photo. But buyers, _(20)_! Some people are not what they claim to be. Still, as yet, most people haven't had too much luck.
 
Q20. (A) beware
(B) be ware
(C) aware
(D) wary
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        People have always been obsessed with their appearance. But with the _(21)_ of plastic surgery, we are now able to change almost any part of our bodies. However, this has _(22)_ a need for perfection. Over the past 20 years, many women _(23)_ breast implants. After a few years, some of the implants leaked, leading to numerous health problems. Furthermore, countless lawsuits have been filed around the world _(24)_ doctors who have made mistakes during operations. _(25)_ matters worse, a new television program in the US, called "Ultimate Makeover," is giving real people free plastic surgery. The results are incredible. But, while only a dozen people get a new look, the rest of the world is only wishing they, too, could be more beautiful.
 
Q21. (A) automation
(B) introduction
(C) reservation
(D) seduction
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        People have always been obsessed with their appearance. But with the _(21)_ of plastic surgery, we are now able to change almost any part of our bodies. However, this has _(22)_ a need for perfection. Over the past 20 years, many women _(23)_ breast implants. After a few years, some of the implants leaked, leading to numerous health problems. Furthermore, countless lawsuits have been filed around the world _(24)_ doctors who have made mistakes during operations. _(25)_ matters worse, a new television program in the US, called "Ultimate Makeover," is giving real people free plastic surgery. The results are incredible. But, while only a dozen people get a new look, the rest of the world is only wishing they, too, could be more beautiful.

(B) gotten rid of
(C) backed up
(D) resulted in

試題解說

(B) your mother will receive a rose.

(D) you can have everything free.

(B) Comic book writers can't think of any new stories.

(A) People can buy costumes.
(B) Many people enjoy watching action movies.

Q40. Why does the author think movie companies are making these movies?
(A) To make money.
(B) To increase interest in comic books.
(C) To attract attention.
(D) Because they are easy to make.

試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第10回

 
Q1. Your high ideals are useless unless you can ______ them into action.

(A) take
(B) put
(C) set
(D) place
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Mary's investment in the stock market ______ millions of dollars every year. No wonder she can afford such a big house.

(A) brings in
(B) takes in
(C) brings up
(D) takes up
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q3. No one wants to ______ that small island, knowing that it will be used as a dumping site for nuclear waste.

(A) live
(B) reside
(C) dwell
(D) inhabit
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q4. Jane was in such a hurry to get to the station that I ______ had a chance to talk to her.

(A) definitely
(B) barely
(C) merely
(D) truly
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q5. Mary and Jane ______ turns taking care of their sick father, who has been bedridden for roughly ten years.

(A) take
(B) make
(C) set
(D) give
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q6. I hate it when any staff member delays ______ what he or she is supposed to do immediately.

(A) to do
(B) doing
(C) do
(D) to have done
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q7. Unless economic conditions ______ next year, there will be widespread unrest across the world.

(A) will improve
(B) improve
(C) has improved
(D) will have improved
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q8. I can tell ______ the sound of those footsteps that John is coming.

(A) on
(B) for
(C) with
(D) by
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q9. The meeting would have been over on time, but George ______ with his long financial report.

(A) had held us up
(B) has held us up
(C) held us up
(D) should have held us up
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q10. These kids were so cute and lovely that the old man decided to give them an apple ______.

(A) respectedly
(B) respectably
(C) respectfully
(D) respectively
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q11. Quarrels often ______ from trifles; they can be avoided if we can all learn to be open-minded.

(A) arouse
(B) arise
(C) rise
(D) raise
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q12. The old man slurs when he talks, so we always have trouble ______ what he says.

(A) to make out
(B) and make out
(C) making out
(D) with making out
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q13. John hardly ever means what he says. I don't think he will tell the truth this time, ______?

(A) doesn't he
(B) does he
(C) will he
(D) do I
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q14. It was not until we finished packing ______ we set out for our destination.

(A) which
(B) then
(C) that
(D) did
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q15. The meeting is expected to take place ______ the morning of December 11 next year.

(A) at
(B) for
(C) in
(D) on
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
        Not long ago, moviegoers were constantly interrupted by the sound of people's cell phones ringing during a movie, play, or concert. During romantic, exciting, or even sad scenes, someone would yell "Wei (喂)?" into his phone, _(16)_ those all around him. Finally, some cell phone companies themselves _(17)_ advertisements before a movie began, showing how disturbing one's personal cell phone ring can be in public. Today, most people turn their cell phones _(18)_ when entering a movie theater. This is good, but many others still let their cell phones ring in libraries, on public transportation, in restaurants, and even in hospitals. This behavior shows _(19)_ for others and should be forbidden. It is time people _(20)_ that when in public, cell phones should be either turned off or set on the quieter vibrator mode. After all, public spaces are not one's private home.
 
Q16. (A) soothing
(B) pleasing
(C) imitating
(D) irritating
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Not long ago, moviegoers were constantly interrupted by the sound of people's cell phones ringing during a movie, play, or concert. During romantic, exciting, or even sad scenes, someone would yell "Wei (喂)?" into his phone, _(16)_ those all around him. Finally, some cell phone companies themselves _(17)_ advertisements before a movie began, showing how disturbing one's personal cell phone ring can be in public. Today, most people turn their cell phones _(18)_ when entering a movie theater. This is good, but many others still let their cell phones ring in libraries, on public transportation, in restaurants, and even in hospitals. This behavior shows _(19)_ for others and should be forbidden. It is time people _(20)_ that when in public, cell phones should be either turned off or set on the quieter vibrator mode. After all, public spaces are not one's private home.
 
Q17. (A) published
(B) laid
(C) placed
(D) announced
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

(B) off
(C) up
(D) in

(B) disregard
(C) concern
(D) respect
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
