Q20. (A) realized
(B) realize
(C) must realize
(D) can realize
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Most young people have seen one of the Alien movies, in which a space monster lays an egg inside a human being. The egg _(21)_ and slowly eats the insides of its victim before it crawls out. This seems like unbelievable science _(22)_, but the fact is that such creatures really _(23)_ right here on Earth. Fortunately, the small insects that lay their eggs inside of others do not choose human beings. _(24)_, caterpillars, those hairy crawling worms which later become beautiful butterflies, are the targets. Once the small flies lay their eggs, there is nothing the caterpillar can do, and for a couple weeks it becomes a moving feast. The saying, "Truth is stranger than fiction," can be _(25)_ by this example from nature.
 
Q21. (A) roves
(B) extends
(C) spoils
(D) hatches
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Most young people have seen one of the Alien movies, in which a space monster lays an egg inside a human being. The egg _(21)_ and slowly eats the insides of its victim before it crawls out. This seems like unbelievable science _(22)_, but the fact is that such creatures really _(23)_ right here on Earth. Fortunately, the small insects that lay their eggs inside of others do not choose human beings. _(24)_, caterpillars, those hairy crawling worms which later become beautiful butterflies, are the targets. Once the small flies lay their eggs, there is nothing the caterpillar can do, and for a couple weeks it becomes a moving feast. The saying, "Truth is stranger than fiction," can be _(25)_ by this example from nature.
 
Q22. (A) fiction
(B) novel
(C) story
(D) report
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Most young people have seen one of the Alien movies, in which a space monster lays an egg inside a human being. The egg _(21)_ and slowly eats the insides of its victim before it crawls out. This seems like unbelievable science _(22)_, but the fact is that such creatures really _(23)_ right here on Earth. Fortunately, the small insects that lay their eggs inside of others do not choose human beings. _(24)_, caterpillars, those hairy crawling worms which later become beautiful butterflies, are the targets. Once the small flies lay their eggs, there is nothing the caterpillar can do, and for a couple weeks it becomes a moving feast. The saying, "Truth is stranger than fiction," can be _(25)_ by this example from nature.
 
Q23. (A) persist
(B) insist
(C) exist
(D) resist
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Most young people have seen one of the Alien movies, in which a space monster lays an egg inside a human being. The egg _(21)_ and slowly eats the insides of its victim before it crawls out. This seems like unbelievable science _(22)_, but the fact is that such creatures really _(23)_ right here on Earth. Fortunately, the small insects that lay their eggs inside of others do not choose human beings. _(24)_, caterpillars, those hairy crawling worms which later become beautiful butterflies, are the targets. Once the small flies lay their eggs, there is nothing the caterpillar can do, and for a couple weeks it becomes a moving feast. The saying, "Truth is stranger than fiction," can be _(25)_ by this example from nature.
 
Q24. (A) Therefore
(B) Instead
(C) Besides
(D) Moreover
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Most young people have seen one of the Alien movies, in which a space monster lays an egg inside a human being. The egg _(21)_ and slowly eats the insides of its victim before it crawls out. This seems like unbelievable science _(22)_, but the fact is that such creatures really _(23)_ right here on Earth. Fortunately, the small insects that lay their eggs inside of others do not choose human beings. _(24)_, caterpillars, those hairy crawling worms which later become beautiful butterflies, are the targets. Once the small flies lay their eggs, there is nothing the caterpillar can do, and for a couple weeks it becomes a moving feast. The saying, "Truth is stranger than fiction," can be _(25)_ by this example from nature.

(B) released
(C) exaggerated
(D) proven

Q32. What does the passage say about earthquakes?

(B) They are less destructive than lava.

(D) They fall from the sky with ash.

[文章中譯]

(A) at the same time.
(B) before.
(C) in only a moment.
(D) over long periods of time.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D

[文章中譯]

 
Q34. Every cloud has a silver lining means
(A) nothing is entirely bad.
(B) volcanic ash covers the sky.

(D) there is good luck when clouds line up.

(A) The price of the products.

(D) good salesmen work their whole lives to earn money.

Q37. How might a newspaper headline concerning this case read?
(A) Pizza: Where Did It All Begin?
(B) Did Roman Soldiers Battle the Chinese?

(D) Why Are Pizzas Round?
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q38. What was the main argument used by the Chinese in this case?
(A) Pizza and mantou are both baked.
(B) China has an older culture than the Roman Empire.
(C) Both pizza and mantou are round.
(D) Marco Polo introduced pizza to Italy 700 years ago.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q39. What was the main argument used by the Italians in this case?
(A) The first pizzas were steamed.
(B) Roman soldiers baked pizzas on their shields.
(C) Marco Polo introduced the pizza to China.
(D) Mantous were imported from China 700 years ago.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q40. How did the judge probably reach his conclusion?
(A) Pizzas were made in Rome before Marco Polo.
(B) Pizzas taste better than mantous.
(C) China has a much older culture than Rome.
(D) Chinese food is famous around the world.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第11回

 
Q1. Since the dawn of history, people ______ the plants and animals around them to better use and appreciate these precious natural resources.

(A) studied
(B) had studied
(C) have studied
(D) studying
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q2. The dog suddenly emerged from behind the door, frightening my little sister so much that she ______ crying.

(A) burst out
(B) burst into
(C) set out
(D) set into
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q3. Addicted to smoking for nearly 10 years, Mary has decided to give up the bad habit for the ______ of her unborn baby.

(A) make
(B) fake
(C) sake
(D) rake
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q4. Food supplies are not as ______ as they were because of poor weather and rising oil prices.

(A) portable
(B) capable
(C) thoughtful
(D) plentiful
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q5. I can ______ you that if we get sufficient help from your department, we can finish the project as scheduled.

(A) ensure
(B) insure
(C) assure
(D) pressure
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q6. With the economy going down, many companies find ______ hard to run their business.

(A) that
(B) it
(C) how
(D) even
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q7. Failure to have a balanced diet can make you feel tired or, in most cases, ______ ill.

(A) fell
(B) fall
(C) fallen
(D) falling
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q8. The rising crime rate in many big cities in the United Kingdom has ______ widespread concern.

(A) risen
(B) arisen
(C) arose
(D) raised
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

(A) promise
(B) will promise
(C) shall promise
(D) have promised
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q10. I was about to leave ______ it started to rain hard, so I had to stay where I was until the rain let up.

(A) then
(B) after
(C) when
(D) until
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

(A) It is
(B) There is
(C) There have
(D) There are
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

(A) has
(B) have
(C) has been
(D) have been

(A) take
(B) was taken
(C) took
(D) was taking

Q14. Because of the delay of the project, it was suggested that the meeting ______ until the end of the month.

(A) postpone
(B) postponed
(C) be postponed
(D) was postponed
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q15. It is said that the boss isn't happy about our work, which ______ yesterday.

(A) should have been done
(B) should be done
(C) must be done
(D) will have been done
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
        The recent economic crisis was not a worldwide event. On one hand, many rich and developed countries like the United States, Japan, Italy, and Greece stopped _(16)_ and even suffered a decrease in their wealth. Many banks lost money, and some even failed. Millions of people lost their jobs and still can't find new ones. On the other hand, such developing countries _(17)_ China, India, Brazil, and Malaysia continued to do very well. They _(18)_ improved their people's living standards with increased incomes and more social services. Moreover, many millions of people who had lived in poverty became members of the middle class. It is nearly impossible to predict _(19)_ countries will continue to do poorly or well, but we can be sure that the world in the next two decades will look quite different from _(20)_ of the last two decades.
 
Q16. (A) growing
(B) to grow
(C) and grew
(D) grown
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The recent economic crisis was not a worldwide event. On one hand, many rich and developed countries like the United States, Japan, Italy, and Greece stopped _(16)_ and even suffered a decrease in their wealth. Many banks lost money, and some even failed. Millions of people lost their jobs and still can't find new ones. On the other hand, such developing countries _(17)_ China, India, Brazil, and Malaysia continued to do very well. They _(18)_ improved their people's living standards with increased incomes and more social services. Moreover, many millions of people who had lived in poverty became members of the middle class. It is nearly impossible to predict _(19)_ countries will continue to do poorly or well, but we can be sure that the world in the next two decades will look quite different from _(20)_ of the last two decades.
 
Q17. (A) like
(B) that
(C) as
(D) and
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The recent economic crisis was not a worldwide event. On one hand, many rich and developed countries like the United States, Japan, Italy, and Greece stopped _(16)_ and even suffered a decrease in their wealth. Many banks lost money, and some even failed. Millions of people lost their jobs and still can't find new ones. On the other hand, such developing countries _(17)_ China, India, Brazil, and Malaysia continued to do very well. They _(18)_ improved their people's living standards with increased incomes and more social services. Moreover, many millions of people who had lived in poverty became members of the middle class. It is nearly impossible to predict _(19)_ countries will continue to do poorly or well, but we can be sure that the world in the next two decades will look quite different from _(20)_ of the last two decades.

(B) noticed
(C) noticeable
(D) noticeably

試題解說

[文章中譯]

Q19. (A) exact which
(B) exactly which
(C) which exact
(D) which exactly
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The recent economic crisis was not a worldwide event. On one hand, many rich and developed countries like the United States, Japan, Italy, and Greece stopped _(16)_ and even suffered a decrease in their wealth. Many banks lost money, and some even failed. Millions of people lost their jobs and still can't find new ones. On the other hand, such developing countries _(17)_ China, India, Brazil, and Malaysia continued to do very well. They _(18)_ improved their people's living standards with increased incomes and more social services. Moreover, many millions of people who had lived in poverty became members of the middle class. Q20. (A) which
(B) that
(C) these
(D) those
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Titles such as ''the best,'' ''the most influential,'' or ''the greatest'' are seldom accurate. In physical science, one of the men who are closest to earning these praises is Sir Isaac Newton. Born in 1642 in England, Newton studied at Cambridge University, _(21)_ he was an average student. The Scientific Revolution was well underway while he was a student, and revolutions bring about much personal and intellectual controversy. Being somewhat shy, Newton avoided public conflict and did much of his work _(22)_ his own, unpublished. Those who realized his genius _(23)_ him to make known his advances in many areas of physical science. Indeed, his work in physics is considered the foundation of modern science, _(24)_ all branches of mathematics and physical science. Perhaps Sir Isaac Newton truly _(25)_ the title of ''The World's Greatest Scientist.''
 
Q21. (A) when
(B) how
(C) where
(D) which
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Titles such as ''the best,'' ''the most influential,'' or ''the greatest'' are seldom accurate. Q37. What is the main idea of the article?
(A) As science develops, views of life change.
(B) Astronomy is the most important science.
(C) Life exists throughout our solar system.
(D) Satellites have discovered life on Earth.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q38. Which field of science is NOT referred to in the article?
(A) Chemistry
(B) Mathematics
(C) Astronomy
(D) Geology
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q39. According to the article, what aspect of Earth has changed?
(A) Its ability to support life
(B) Its distance to the stars
(C) Its size
(D) Its age
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q40. Which factor is necessary to support life?
(A) The number of planets in a solar system
(B) The number of stars in the universe
(C) Water and oxygen
(D) The age and size of a planet
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第12回

 
Q1. It's very cloudy now, so you'd better carry an umbrella with you lest it ______.

(A) rain
(B) rains
(C) will rain
(D) can rain
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q2. To tell you the truth, ______ for your help, I wouldn't have been able to finish the work as scheduled.

(A) had it not been
(B) if it were not
(C) if there had not been
(D) if there were not
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q3. Many members of the Legislative Yuan strongly suggested that new duties ______ on luxury items.

(A) impose
(B) be imposed
(C) were imposed
(D) have to impose
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q4. To lower teenage car accident rates, it is essential that every school ______ children about traffic laws.

(A) teaches
(B) will be teaching
(C) teach
(D) taught
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q5. ______ for a work permit, send your resume together with two recent photos to our office no later than March 31.

(A) Apply
(B) To apply
(C) Applying
(D) If applied

試題解說


     
 
Q6. You have no choice but ______ to Susan for what you did to her yesterday morning.

(A) to apologize
(B) apologize
(C) apologizing
(D) apologized
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

(A) to
(B) for
(C) with
(D) against
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

(A) watched TV
(B) watch TV
(C) to watch TV
(D) watching TV

試題解說

(A) to figure out
(B) figure out
(C) and figure out
(D) figuring out
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

(A) to correct
(B) correcting
(C) to be correcting
(D) correct

Q11. Research has shown that laughter has a beneficial effect ______ our immune system.

(A) of
(B) with
(C) on
(D) for

(A) Seen
(B) Kept
(C) Drifted
(D) Flown

(A) saying
(B) said
(C) to say
(D) say

(A) like
(B) which
(C) as
(D) when

試題解說


     
 
Q15. Peter has a passion for outdoor activities, among ______ hiking is his favorite.

(A) them
(B) which
(C) what
(D) that
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
        We often hear that English is the international language. There are several reasons for this. It is the only official language spoken natively by at least one country on each of the six _(16)_ continents. English _(17)_ an official language at most scientific, technological, sports, political, and business international events. And second-language speakers of English are growing at a very fast _(18)_ around the world. It has been estimated that by 2050 English will be spoken as a native language by more speakers than Mandarin, currently the language with the largest _(19)_ of native speakers.
　　What is perhaps most interesting about English is that it did not originate in England. Vikings brought German and Scandinavian dialects to England more than a thousand years ago, and those dialects developed into _(20)_ today is known as English. That is another reason that English is truly the international language!
 
Q16. (A) popular
(B) populated
(C) population
(D) popularity
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        We often hear that English is the international language. There are several reasons for this. It is the only official language spoken natively by at least one country on each of the six _(16)_ continents. English _(17)_ an official language at most scientific, technological, sports, political, and business international events. And second-language speakers of English are growing at a very fast _(18)_ around the world. It has been estimated that by 2050 English will be spoken as a native language by more speakers than Mandarin, currently the language with the largest _(19)_ of native speakers.
　　What is perhaps most interesting about English is that it did not originate in England. Vikings brought German and Scandinavian dialects to England more than a thousand years ago, and those dialects developed into _(20)_ today is known as English. That is another reason that English is truly the international language!

(B) is used as
(C) used for
(D) used to being
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

Q20. (A) which
(B) that
(C) what
(D) whether
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The Mona Lisa is considered the world's most famous painting. On public _(21)_ at the Louvre Museum in Paris, it has been seen by millions. It is more _(22)_ seen in endless reproductions of the faintly smiling, long-haired woman on T-shirts, product labels, and in cartoons. Leonardo da Vinci was the artist responsible for this interesting, unforgettable image.
　　Born in 1452 in Italy, Leonardo showed early promise as an artist. In addition to painting, however, he also _(23)_ in engineering and anatomy, the study of the body. Though few of his paintings before his death in 1519 survive, thousands of his drawings _(24)_.These show his true genius. Leonardo da Vinci has been declared a true Renaissance man, a person who is familiar _(25)_ and skilled in many different areas. There may never again be a Renaissance man like Leonardo da Vinci.
 
Q21. (A) duty
(B) display
(C) errand
(D) call
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The Mona Lisa is considered the world's most famous painting. On public _(21)_ at the Louvre Museum in Paris, it has been seen by millions. 閱讀 第13回

 
Q1. I like everything about the brand-new car ______ the color, which I think is a little too dark.

(A) in addition to
(B) except for
(C) beside
(D) owing to
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Do not skip breakfast because it ______ you with the energy you need to start you off on a long day's work.

(A) offers
(B) gives
(C) brings
(D) provides
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q3. Due to the strong typhoon, all schools along the east coast will be closed and all activities will be cancelled for safety's ______.

(A) benefit
(B) good
(C) sake
(D) cause
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q4. I wish John ______ here now so he could join me in doing the assignment that is due tomorrow.

(A) is
(B) was
(C) were
(D) will be
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q5. With regard to ______, you should carry more money than needed because you are likely to find something which you like but is a little too expensive.

(A) shop
(B) shopping
(C) buy
(D) buying
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q6. Effective listening requires us to pay attention to facial expressions, body movement, ______ to the tone of the other person's voice.

(A) as soon as
(B) as far as
(C) as long as
(D) as well as
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q7. ______ those students were young and inexperienced, they had indeed done a pretty good job.

(A) In that
(B) Except that
(C) For that
(D) Given that
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q8. Hobbies vary with people. Some go for reading, ______ others enjoy outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

(A) while
(B) when
(C) so
(D) however
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q9. The machine may look a little complicated; ______, it is a relatively simple device.

(A) however
(B) therefore
(C) besides
(D) furthermore
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q10. Health is important, but most people do not know its value ______ they have lost their health.

(A) since
(B) because
(C) until
(D) before
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q11. One of the most important steps you need to take to improve your health ______ to exercise regularly.

(A) is
(B) are
(C) being
(D) has
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

(A) is
(B) are
(C) have
(D) has
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A

(A) have
(B) having
(C) to have
(D) has
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q14. The ______ of American universities that offer scholarships to foreign students is decreasing.

(A) amount
(B) quantity
(C) number
(D) sum
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q15. You ought to know better than ______ friends with that man, who tends to lie and is never trustworthy.

(A) make
(B) to make
(C) making
(D) makes
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
        Some people live their whole lives with the same personalities. On the other hand, _(16)_ go through significant changes. Karen was one of the latter.
　　As a child and teenager, Karen was extremely sociable and _(17)_. She had many friends and was always busy with social events. She was even considered the life of the party. _(18)_, by the time she was a college student, Miss Sunshine, as some of her friends called her, became quiet and short-tempered. Gone were the parties, and rarely _(19)_ hanging out with others. After graduation, she moved out of her parents' house and lived _(20)_. No one could explain why she had changed so much. Whatever the cause, Karen is a good example of a person who undergoes a major personality change.
 
Q16. (A) others
(B) the others
(C) the other
(D) another
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Some people live their whole lives with the same personalities. On the other hand, _(16)_ go through significant changes. Karen was one of the latter.
　　As a child and teenager, Karen was extremely sociable and _(17)_. She had many friends and was always busy with social events. She was even considered the life of the party. _(18)_, by the time she was a college student, Miss Sunshine, as some of her friends called her, became quiet and short-tempered. Gone were the parties, and rarely _(19)_ hanging out with others. After graduation, she moved out of her parents' house and lived _(20)_. No one could explain why she had changed so much. Whatever the cause, Karen is a good example of a person who undergoes a major personality change.

(B) outgoing
(C) shy
(D) clumsy
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

Q19. (A) Karen saw
(B) did Karen see
(C) Karen was seen
(D) was Karen seen
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Some people live their whole lives with the same personalities. On the other hand, _(16)_ go through significant changes. Karen was one of the latter.
　　As a child and teenager, Karen was extremely sociable and _(17)_. She had many friends and was always busy with social events. She was even considered the life of the party. _(18)_, by the time she was a college student, Miss Sunshine, as some of her friends called her, became quiet and short-tempered. Whatever the cause, Karen is a good example of a person who undergoes a major personality change.
 
Q20. (A) lonely
(B) lonesome
(C) alone
(D) lone
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        For many decades, protection agencies around the world have followed the policy of putting _(21)_ any and all fires in forested parklands. Nowadays, that policy is the center of a heated debate.
　　The practice of putting out fires most likely originated from the idea of putting out house fires. Fires were seen as the enemy of forests. However, research _(22)_ over the past 20 years offers a different view on fires. They are natural forces that clear out old forests, _(23)_ them regrow. According to this point of view, forest fires are important in bringing new life to old forests. In fact, the best time for many trees to release their seeds _(24)_ when they are on fire. The rich nutrients from the ash help small trees grow quickly and strong.
　　No matter _(25)_ view you take, all visitors to forestlands should always take special care not to start a forest fire.
 
Q21. (A) out
(B) off
(C) up
(D) on
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        For many decades, protection agencies around the world have followed the policy of putting _(21)_ any and all fires in forested parklands. Nowadays, that policy is the center of a heated debate.
　　The practice of putting out fires most likely originated from the idea of putting out house fires. Fires were seen as the enemy of forests. However, research _(22)_ over the past 20 years offers a different view on fires. They are natural forces that clear out old forests, _(23)_ them regrow. According to this point of view, forest fires are important in bringing new life to old forests. In fact, the best time for many trees to release their seeds _(24)_ when they are on fire. The rich nutrients from the ash help small trees grow quickly and strong.
　　No matter _(25)_ view you take, all visitors to forestlands should always take special care not to start a forest fire.
 
Q22. (A) conduct
(B) conducted
(C) conducting
(D) conducts
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        For many decades, protection agencies around the world have followed the policy of putting _(21)_ any and all fires in forested parklands. Nowadays, that policy is the center of a heated debate.
　　The practice of putting out fires most likely originated from the idea of putting out house fires. Fires were seen as the enemy of forests. However, research _(22)_ over the past 20 years offers a different view on fires. They are natural forces that clear out old forests, _(23)_ them regrow. According to this point of view, forest fires are important in bringing new life to old forests. In fact, the best time for many trees to release their seeds _(24)_ when they are on fire. The rich nutrients from the ash help small trees grow quickly and strong.
　　No matter _(25)_ view you take, all visitors to forestlands should always take special care not to start a forest fire.

(B) helping

(D) that help

　　No matter _(25)_ view you take, all visitors to forestlands should always take special care not to start a forest fire.

(B) being
(C) is
(D) been
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        For many decades, protection agencies around the world have followed the policy of putting _(21)_ any and all fires in forested parklands. Nowadays, that policy is the center of a heated debate.
　　The practice of putting out fires most likely originated from the idea of putting out house fires. Fires were seen as the enemy of forests. However, research _(22)_ over the past 20 years offers a different view on fires. They are natural forces that clear out old forests, _(23)_ them regrow. According to this point of view, forest fires are important in bringing new life to old forests. In fact, the best time for many trees to release their seeds _(24)_ when they are on fire. The rich nutrients from the ash help small trees grow quickly and strong.
　　No matter _(25)_ view you take, all visitors to forestlands should always take special care not to start a forest fire.

閱讀 第14回

 
Q1. Useful to scientists and ______ to collectors, meteorites are a big part of astronomical study.

(A) fascinate
(B) fascinated
(C) fascinating
(D) fascination
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q2. I'm currently busy, but I promise I will deal with the problem ______ this afternoon.

(A) some time
(B) sometimes
(C) sometime
(D) some times
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q3. A tiger is ______ animal as a lion even though the former is a little smaller in size.

(A) as a strong
(B) as strong an
(C) strong as
(D) such strong
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q4. Paul did such a good job at the meeting ______ his boss thought highly of him and gave him two days' leave.

(A) so
(B) therefore
(C) that
(D) which
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

(A) collide
(B) provide
(C) sympathize
(D) participate

試題解說

(A) Despite
(B) Due to
(C) Thanks to
(D) Though

試題解說

(B) lost

(D) loss

Q15. John didn't succeed by luck—it was constant hard work that made him what he ______ today.

(A) has
(B) has
(C) makes
(D) is
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
        The next time you want a new pet, try the city pound. This is a place _(16)_ stray animals are kept after they are caught outside without owners. These animals need homes. Because of the large number of stray animals, the city government doesn't have enough money to _(17)_ them. _(18)_, the government has to put the animals to sleep after a period of time.
　　A pet does not have to be expensive for it to love you or for you to love it. In fact, most of the stray animals were once pets. Their owners could not or would not take care of them and _(19)_ them on the street. This is very sad. Pets need our care just as babies _(20)_ No one should take in a pet unless they are prepared to care for an animal its whole life.
 
Q16. (A) which
(B) what
(C) where
(D) when
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The next time you want a new pet, try the city pound. This is a place _(16)_ stray animals are kept after they are caught outside without owners. These animals need homes. Because of the large number of stray animals, the city government doesn't have enough money to _(17)_ them. _(18)_, the government has to put the animals to sleep after a period of time.
　　A pet does not have to be expensive for it to love you or for you to love it. In fact, most of the stray animals were once pets. Their owners could not or would not take care of them and _(19)_ them on the street. This is very sad. Pets need our care just as babies _(20)_ No one should take in a pet unless they are prepared to care for an animal its whole life.

(B) raise

(D) arouse

Q20. (A) are
(B) need
(C) do
(D) can
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Cuckoo clocks are famous around the world. At the strike of each hour, a wooden bird comes out of the clock and chirps happily. In clocks, they seem adorable, but real cuckoo birds are _(21)_ cute.
　　The female cuckoo is an unusual bird. Instead of making a nest for her eggs, she _(22)_ her eggs in the nest of another bird. Amazingly, the mother can produce eggs which _(23)_ those already in the nest. Then, the hardworking parents of the nest _(24)_ the baby cuckoo as if it were their own. Since cuckoo chicks are often larger than the other chicks, the young cuckoo kicks the other babies out of the nest. _(25)_, the cuckoo chick can eat all of the food the unsuspecting parents bring back to the nest.
 
Q21. (A) equal to
(B) anything but
(C) due to
(D) more than
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Cuckoo clocks are famous around the world. At the strike of each hour, a wooden bird comes out of the clock and chirps happily. In clocks, they seem adorable, but real cuckoo birds are _(21)_ cute.
　　The female cuckoo is an unusual bird. Instead of making a nest for her eggs, she _(22)_ her eggs in the nest of another bird. Amazingly, the mother can produce eggs which _(23)_ those already in the nest. Then, the hardworking parents of the nest _(24)_ the baby cuckoo as if it were their own. Since cuckoo chicks are often larger than the other chicks, the young cuckoo kicks the other babies out of the nest. _(25)_, the cuckoo chick can eat all of the food the unsuspecting parents bring back to the nest.

(B) lain
(C) lies
(D) lays
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Cuckoo clocks are famous around the world. At the strike of each hour, a wooden bird comes out of the clock and chirps happily. In clocks, they seem adorable, but real cuckoo birds are _(21)_ cute.

Q23. (A) resolve
(B) restrict
(C) resemble
(D) reserve
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Cuckoo clocks are famous around the world. At the strike of each hour, a wooden bird comes out of the clock and chirps happily. In clocks, they seem adorable, but real cuckoo birds are _(21)_ cute.
　　The female cuckoo is an unusual bird. Instead of making a nest for her eggs, she _(22)_ her eggs in the nest of another bird. Amazingly, the mother can produce eggs which _(23)_ those already in the nest. Then, the hardworking parents of the nest _(24)_ the baby cuckoo as if it were their own. Since cuckoo chicks are often larger than the other chicks, the young cuckoo kicks the other babies out of the nest. _(25)_, the cuckoo chick can eat all of the food the unsuspecting parents bring back to the nest.
 
Q24. (A) feed
(B) seed
(C) eat
(D) lead
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Cuckoo clocks are famous around the world. At the strike of each hour, a wooden bird comes out of the clock and chirps happily. In clocks, they seem adorable, but real cuckoo birds are _(21)_ cute.
　　The female cuckoo is an unusual bird. Instead of making a nest for her eggs, she _(22)_ her eggs in the nest of another bird. Amazingly, the mother can produce eggs which _(23)_ those already in the nest. Then, the hardworking parents of the nest _(24)_ the baby cuckoo as if it were their own. Since cuckoo chicks are often larger than the other chicks, the young cuckoo kicks the other babies out of the nest. _(25)_, the cuckoo chick can eat all of the food the unsuspecting parents bring back to the nest.
 
Q25. (A) On the way
(B) In this way
(C) By the way
(D) In the way
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

(D) Seventeen dollars

閱讀 第15回

 
Q1. The massive earthquake and tsunami that happened in Japan on March 11, 2011 ______ tens of thousands of lives.

(A) claimed
(B) acclaimed
(C) proclaimed
(D) exclaimed
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Though he is now best known as a writer, Mr. Li ______ a living for years selling used cars.

(A) did
(B) made
(C) formed
(D) had
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q3. Once you catch a cold, make sure you ______ plenty of water, which helps soothe many symptoms.

(A) drink
(B) drank
(C) must drink
(D) will drink
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q4. Over the past thirty years, Mr. Johnson has taught many students, ______ have become successful businessmen.

(A) some of them
(B) some of whom
(C) of them some
(D) of which some
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

(A) drew
(B) drove
(C) played
(D) made

(B) so
(C) then
(D) that

Q15. After helping his wife do the dishes, Mr. Green lay on the couch ______ TV.

(A) and watch
(B) to watch
(C) watching
(D) watched

試題解說


     
        The flute is one of the most well-known musical instruments. What is less well known is the fact _(16)_, currently, they are the earliest known musical instrument. Flutes that were carved from animal bones dating back over 30,000 years _(17)_ in what is today Germany. What is even more interesting is that this instrument developed independently, though much later, in both China and India. The earliest Chinese flute was also carved from bone _(18)_ 9000 years ago, while the earliest Indian flute was made of bamboo. These early European and Chinese flutes had finger holes to produce different notes, but the Indian variety _(19)_. The Indian flute player used his breath to make different sounds. Today all symphony orchestras have several flutes contributing their timeless sound _(20)_ the magnificence of orchestral music.
 
Q16. (A) which
(B) that
(C) how
(D) when
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The flute is one of the most well-known musical instruments. What is less well known is the fact _(16)_, currently, they are the earliest known musical instrument. Flutes that were carved from animal bones dating back over 30,000 years _(17)_ in what is today Germany. What is even more interesting is that this instrument developed independently, though much later, in both China and India. The earliest Chinese flute was also carved from bone _(18)_ 9000 years ago, while the earliest Indian flute was made of bamboo. These early European and Chinese flutes had finger holes to produce different notes, but the Indian variety _(19)_. The Indian flute player used his breath to make different sounds. Today all symphony orchestras have several flutes contributing their timeless sound _(20)_ the magnificence of orchestral music.
 
Q17. (A) found
(B) to be found
(C) have been found
(D) was found
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The flute is one of the most well-known musical instruments. What is less well known is the fact _(16)_, currently, they are the earliest known musical instrument. (B) a little
(C) a few
(D) a lot

(B) did not
(C) are not
(D) have not
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The flute is one of the most well-known musical instruments. What is less well known is the fact _(16)_, currently, they are the earliest known musical instrument. (B) for
(C) on
(D) to
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Widely considered the finest martial artist of our time, Bruce Lee had a highpowered but short-lived life. Lee was born in San Francisco, California in 1940 and was the youngest of five children. His family returned to their home in Hong Kong while Lee was _(21)_ an infant. _(22)_ the time he was 18, he returned to the US for further education and to claim his American citizenship. Thereafter, he spent time in both the US and Hong Kong.
　　Before Bruce Lee, Chinese martial arts were little known outside East Asia. By developing his own personal style of fighting, Lee _(23)_ through his movies the superb skills a true martial artist must have. Among his more popular films _(24)_ Way of the Dragon (1972), which he directed, and Enter the Dragon (1973). In that same year, Lee died in Hong Kong while working on another film, _(25)_ a spectacular but short life.
 
Q21. (A) already
(B) still
(C) even
(D) ever
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Widely considered the finest martial artist of our time, Bruce Lee had a highpowered but short-lived life. Lee was born in San Francisco, California in 1940 and was the youngest of five children. His family returned to their home in Hong Kong while Lee was _(21)_ an infant. _(22)_ the time he was 18, he returned to the US for further education and to claim his American citizenship. Thereafter, he spent time in both the US and Hong Kong.

(B) Its culture
(C) Its wildlife
(D) Its seashore
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q39. Which of the following statements about Hilton Head Island is true?
(A) It is larger than South Carolina.
(B) It is located in the Atlantic Ocean.
(C) It was built in 1663.
(D) It was incorporated in 1663.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q40. What is unusual about Hilton Head Island?
(A) It is located on the east coast of the United States.
(B) It is located in the state of South Carolina.
(C) It offers a variety of cultural events.
(D) It is uncommonly eco-friendly.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第16回

 
Q1. It was so kind ______ you to offer me help at a time I needed it badly. Thanks a million.

(A) for
(B) with
(C) about
(D) of
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q2. The newly built shopping mall around the corner is ______ bigger than the others in this area.

(A) far
(B) more
(C) most
(D) very
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q3. There used to ______ a river near our village where I would often go fishing with my dad when I was young.

(A) have
(B) be
(C) having
(D) being
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q4. Peter lacks a sense of direction, ______ is the reason why he doesn't like to drive without me sitting next to him.

(A) that
(B) what
(C) which
(D) it
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q5. If there is something wrong with the item you ______ at our store, you may ask for a refund.

(A) possess
(B) purchase
(C) pay
(D) perform
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q6. The saying, ''A man is known by the ______ he keeps,'' simply means that our character is reflected in the choice of friends.

(A) company
(B) accompany
(C) champion
(D) championship
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q7. During a severe recession, many companies are forced to ______ employees in order to tide over the difficulties.

(A) lie down
(B) lay off
(C) set out
(D) break up

(A) interview
(B) to interview
(C) interviewed
(D) interviewing

試題解說

(A) commands
(B) commends
(C) comments
(D) commentates

試題解說

(A) sunbathing
(B) sunbathe
(C) sunbath
(D) to sunbathe
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A

(A) enjoyed
(B) enjoys
(C) to enjoy
(D) enjoying

(A) what
(B) that
(C) which
(D) they

(A) discipline
(B) performance
(C) occurrence
(D) favorite

(A) had I
(B) if I
(C) were I
(D) should I
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q15. Life is like a beautiful and winding lane, on either side of ______ are many lovely things for us to admire.

(A) it
(B) them
(C) there
(D) which
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
        The year 2011 may be written in weather history books as "The Year of the Tornado." These fast-rotating, violent wind storms may be _(16)_ by heavy rain and even hail, often making them deadly. They can happen on any continent except Antarctica, though in most countries they are rare meteorological events. Not so in the United States. About half of all recorded tornadoes in the world _(17)_ in the eastern half of that country.
　　Though deaths _(18)_ tornadoes through May 2011 have occurred in Bangladesh, the Philippines, and New Zealand, the total of 14 deaths in those countries is _(19)_ in comparison to the some 500 known lives _(20)_ by tornadoes in the U.S. The tornado season is already the worst on record for nearly the past 60 years. This year's tornado season may yet go down as the very worst in U.S. weather history.
 
Q16. (A) accomplished
(B) accompanied
(C) accounted
(D) accused
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The year 2011 may be written in weather history books as "The Year of the Tornado." These fast-rotating, violent wind storms may be _(16)_ by heavy rain and even hail, often making them deadly. They can happen on any continent except Antarctica, though in most countries they are rare meteorological events. Not so in the United States. About half of all recorded tornadoes in the world _(17)_ in the eastern half of that country.
　　Though deaths _(18)_ tornadoes through May 2011 have occurred in Bangladesh, the Philippines, and New Zealand, the total of 14 deaths in those countries is _(19)_ in comparison to the some 500 known lives _(20)_ by tornadoes in the U.S. The tornado season is already the worst on record for nearly the past 60 years. This year's tornado season may yet go down as the very worst in U.S. weather history.
 
Q17. (A) occur
(B) are happened
(C) are held
(D) are taken place
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        The year 2011 may be written in weather history books as "The Year of the Tornado." This year's tornado season may yet go down as the very worst in U.S. weather history.

(C) due to
(D) as to
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C

(B) anything
(C) everything
(D) nothing

Q20. (A) claimed
(B) proclaimed
(C) acclaimed
(D) exclaimed
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Everyone knows who Jackie Chan is, and most kids today even know who Bruce Lee was. The name Ti Long (also spelled Di Long), _(21)_, would hardly be recognized by anyone under 40. That's a shame, _(22)_ at the height of his popularity in the 1960s and 1970s, the only martial artist superstar was Ti Long.
　　Born in 1946 in Hong Kong, Ti Long was the _(23)_ actor for the many Shaw Brothers martial arts movies. He was strongly built, _(24)_ handsome, and highly skilled in traditional martial arts weapons. He acted with Jackie Chan when Jackie was just getting his own career started. He also worked with the world-renowned director John Woo. Even after the heyday of Hong Kong martial arts films, Ti Long has continued to act in more modern day films. You may not be familiar _(25)_ Ti Long, but your parents and grandparents certainly are!
 
Q21. (A) therefore
(B) besides
(C) however
(D) moreover
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

Q1. An ice hotel is just what it sounds like: a hotel ______ entirely from snow and ice.

(A) made
(B) making
(C) to make
(D) makes
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Dangerous ______ extreme sports are, you can always make preparations in advance.

(A) because
(B) so
(C) as
(D) when
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q3. Whatever you decide to do, be sure to use proper gear and ______ safety precautions.

(A) make
(B) do
(C) take
(D) keep
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q4. At the news conference this morning, the mayor encouraged all citizens to ______ energy and reduce carbon emissions.

(A) reserve
(B) preserve
(C) deserve
(D) conserve
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q5. To save our environment from being further polluted, I suggest you use batteries that can be ______.

(A) recharged
(B) restored
(C) recorded
(D) repeated
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

(A) of
(B) on
(C) in
(D) over
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

(A) free
(B) freedom
(C) sale
(D) instance
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

(A) such
(B) such a
(C) so
(D) so a

(B) privilege
(C) performance
(D) priority

(B) insure
(C) assure
(D) treasure

(B) changes

(D) champions

(D) getting

(B) sent
(C) be sent
(D) was sent

Q14. Most couples who divorce ______ they grew apart because they no longer shared interesting things together.

(A) say
(B) to say
(C) saying
(D) says

Q15. People who are emotionally healthy are ______ of building strong relationships and leading productive lives.

(A) responsible
(B) competent
(C) capable
(D) inevitable
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
        Since the dawn of history, people _(16)_ the plants and animals around them to better use and appreciate these precious natural resources. With the rise of science in the 19th century, Charles Darwin contributed _(17)_ to the understanding of nature than perhaps any other single individual. For his contributions, Darwin is sometimes called "The Father of Biology."
　　Darwin's chief contribution was his Theory of Evolution by Natural Selection. Though he was not _(18)_ in conceiving this theory, Darwin's reputation as a renowned biologist _(19)_ spread the idea throughout European and North American universities and research institutes. The concept that favorable adaptations could be transferred from generation to generation is a theory that still stands today. Certainly there has been no greater insight into the natural world than _(20)_ of Charles Darwin.
 
Q16. (A) study
(B) studied
(C) were studying
(D) have studied
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Since the dawn of history, people _(16)_ the plants and animals around them to better use and appreciate these precious natural resources. With the rise of science in the 19th century, Charles Darwin contributed _(17)_ to the understanding of nature than perhaps any other single individual. For his contributions, Darwin is sometimes called "The Father of Biology."
　　Darwin's chief contribution was his Theory of Evolution by Natural Selection. Though he was not _(18)_ in conceiving this theory, Darwin's reputation as a renowned biologist _(19)_ spread the idea throughout European and North American universities and research institutes. The concept that favorable adaptations could be transferred from generation to generation is a theory that still stands today. Certainly there has been no greater insight into the natural world than _(20)_ of Charles Darwin.
 
Q17. (A) as much
(B) a lot
(C) more
(D) a great deal
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Since the dawn of history, people _(16)_ the plants and animals around them to better use and appreciate these precious natural resources. With the rise of science in the 19th century, Charles Darwin contributed _(17)_ to the understanding of nature than perhaps any other single individual. The concept that favorable adaptations could be transferred from generation to generation is a theory that still stands today. Certainly there has been no greater insight into the natural world than _(20)_ of Charles Darwin.

(B) lonesome
(C) alone

Q20. (A) that
(B) this
(C) those
(D) these
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Nearly every day in every city around the world, you can hear the following complaints. "The traffic is terrible and it's getting worse!" "The pollution is _(21)_ and it's going to kill us!" "It's so noisy in the city! There is no peace and quiet." Most of these complaints are true, _(22)_ sometimes. However, if the city is such a bad place to live, why are cities growing in _(23)_ in every country?
　　The simple _(24)_ is opportunity. Cities provide the best education and health care, the most mobs, and the most interesting environment. The country is cleaner, quieter, and friendlier, but apparently, people are more interested in their work and their children's education. That is _(25)_, according to the United Nations, just over half of the world's population is now living in cities, and the cities are growing. Welcome to city living. Welcome to the future.
 
Q21. (A) awful
(B) beneficial
(C) gorgeous
(D) meaningful
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

Q28. According to the article, why are biofuels having an impact on food prices?
(A) Because oil prices are getting higher and higher
(B) Because farmers are growing fewer crops for food
(C) Because biofuels create a larger supply of crops
(D) Because droughts have affected agricultural production

(B) Using batteries to power automobiles
(C) Growing corn and then turning it into energy
(D) Taking energy from the sun and the wind

試題解說

[文章中譯]

(D) The World Bank will keep criticizing the production of biofuels.

閱讀 第18回

 
Q1. Guide dogs, also called seeing-eye dogs, are assistance dogs trained to lead blind or ______ impaired people around obstacles.

(A) visually
(B) audibly
(C) mentally
(D) usually
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q2. I was about to go to bed ______ the phone rang, and I wondered who was calling deep in the night.

(A) once
(B) after
(C) when
(D) during
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q3. I haven't seen my friend John for ages, but we keep in touch with each other by e-mail ______.

(A) every now and then
(B) back and forth
(C) for the time being
(D) quite a while
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q4. ______ one out of every two American marriages ending in divorce, custody of children has become a big issue in the American society.

(A) With
(B) By
(C) For
(D) Because

(B) which
(C) that
(D) for which

(B) host

(D) to host

(B) jogging
(C) jogs

Q15. The first step you should ______ in preparation for a meeting is to find a suitable meeting place.

(A) take
(B) make
(C) do
(D) measure
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
        Suddenly the sky darkens, and you feel a strong wind. _(16)_, you see rain clouds overhead. You reach for an umbrella. While today umbrellas _(17)_ modern plastics and processed metals, they have a history that _(18)_ thousands of years. Most major early civilizations such as Egypt, China, India, and the Middle East developed umbrellas to protect against rain and parasols to protect against sunshine. In some cultures, umbrellas were used by only the royalty; in _(19)_, umbrellas were a fashion statement used by the middle classes. Some umbrellas and parasols were painted or decorated and became objects of art in addition to their original purpose. Simple, inexpensive, and practical, umbrellas and parasols will probably _(20)_ be used many centuries into the future.
 
Q16. (A) Look up
(B) Looking up
(C) To look up
(D) Looked up
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Suddenly the sky darkens, and you feel a strong wind. _(16)_, you see rain clouds overhead. You reach for an umbrella. While today umbrellas _(17)_ modern plastics and processed metals, they have a history that _(18)_ thousands of years. Most major early civilizations such as Egypt, China, India, and the Middle East developed umbrellas to protect against rain and parasols to protect against sunshine. In some cultures, umbrellas were used by only the royalty; in _(19)_, umbrellas were a fashion statement used by the middle classes. Some umbrellas and parasols were painted or decorated and became objects of art in addition to their original purpose. Simple, inexpensive, and practical, umbrellas and parasols will probably _(20)_ be used many centuries into the future.

Q20. (A) ever
(B) soon
(C) already
(D) still
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Not many people are named after the place they were born, but this is not what made Florence Nightingale famous. Instead, she is renowned _(21)_ the introduction of nursing and the concept of public hygiene.
　　Born in Florence, Italy into a rich English family in 1820, Nightingale _(22)_ to marry a wealthy man and raise his family. Instead, she felt a calling to become a nurse and train others in the hygienic care of those _(23)_ were ill or in pain. She volunteered to care for wounded British soldiers during the Crimean War. There she _(24)_ her nickname "the lady with the lamp" because of her evening rounds to care for soldiers. In 1860, she _(25)_ the first nursing school and worked tirelessly to raise public awareness about the importance of personal and public hygiene. The world today is a far better place for her efforts.
 
Q21. (A) for
(B) as
(C) to
(D) by
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Not many people are named after the place they were born, but this is not what made Florence Nightingale famous. Instead, she is renowned _(21)_ the introduction of nursing and the concept of public hygiene.
　　Born in Florence, Italy into a rich English family in 1820, Nightingale _(22)_ to marry a wealthy man and raise his family. Instead, she felt a calling to become a nurse and train others in the hygienic care of those _(23)_ were ill or in pain. She volunteered to care for wounded British soldiers during the Crimean War. There she _(24)_ her nickname "the lady with the lamp" because of her evening rounds to care for soldiers. In 1860, she _(25)_ the first nursing school and worked tirelessly to raise public awareness about the importance of personal and public hygiene. The world today is a far better place for her efforts.
 
Q22. (A) expected
(B) was expected
(C) has expected
(D) was expecting
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Not many people are named after the place they were born, but this is not what made Florence Nightingale famous. Instead, she is renowned _(21)_ the introduction of nursing and the concept of public hygiene.

There she _(24)_ her nickname "the lady with the lamp" because of her evening rounds to care for soldiers. In 1860, she _(25)_ the first nursing school and worked tirelessly to raise public awareness about the importance of personal and public hygiene. The world today is a far better place for her efforts.
 
Q23. (A) who
(B) whom
(C) which
(D) where
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Not many people are named after the place they were born, but this is not what made Florence Nightingale famous. Instead, she is renowned _(21)_ the introduction of nursing and the concept of public hygiene.
　　Born in Florence, Italy into a rich English family in 1820, Nightingale _(22)_ to marry a wealthy man and raise his family. Instead, she felt a calling to become a nurse and train others in the hygienic care of those _(23)_ were ill or in pain. She volunteered to care for wounded British soldiers during the Crimean War. There she _(24)_ her nickname "the lady with the lamp" because of her evening rounds to care for soldiers. In 1860, she _(25)_ the first nursing school and worked tirelessly to raise public awareness about the importance of personal and public hygiene. The world today is a far better place for her efforts.
 
Q24. (A) lost
(B) earned
(C) offered
(D) provided
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Not many people are named after the place they were born, but this is not what made Florence Nightingale famous. Instead, she is renowned _(21)_ the introduction of nursing and the concept of public hygiene.
　　Born in Florence, Italy into a rich English family in 1820, Nightingale _(22)_ to marry a wealthy man and raise his family. Instead, she felt a calling to become a nurse and train others in the hygienic care of those _(23)_ were ill or in pain. She volunteered to care for wounded British soldiers during the Crimean War. There she _(24)_ her nickname "the lady with the lamp" because of her evening rounds to care for soldiers. In 1860, she _(25)_ the first nursing school and worked tirelessly to raise public awareness about the importance of personal and public hygiene. The world today is a far better place for her efforts.
 
Q25. (A) found
(B) finds
(C) founded
(D) finding
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

閱讀 第19回

 
Q1. Eating fruits and vegetables ______ the risk of heart disease, cancer, and high blood pressure.

(A) lower
(B) lowers
(C) to lower
(D) lowering
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q2. Eight hours of sleep is necessary, but who can ______ to spend so much time sleeping?

(A) afford
(B) provide
(C) support
(D) improve
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q3. Lack of exercise, unhealthy diet and other medical problems ______ to mental and physical weakness in older people.

(A) result
(B) bring
(C) lead
(D) stick
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

(A) Though
(B) While
(C) As
(D) Despite

試題解說

(B) to not smoke
(C) not to smoke
(D) smoke not

Q15. Stop fooling around, Tom. Only by studying hard ______ admitted to the university of your choice.

(A) you can get
(B) you will get
(C) did you get
(D) can you get

試題解說


     
        It is a known fact that Taiwan is an island. Just like many other islands, there are smaller islands, such as Green Island and Orchid Island, _(16)_ its coast. The _(17)_ is home to mostly indigenous people.
　　At only 45 square kilometers in area, Orchid Island is small indeed. _(18)_ 800 years ago, the Tao People from the northern Philippines migrated to Orchid Island, which is known as Ponso no Tao in their language. The highest peak on the island is over 500 meters, and the local people _(19)_ in fishing and farming.
　　The island was off-limits to the public during the Japanese occupation, and then under the rule of the Taiwanese government, the ban was lifted in 1967. As a result, the original inhabitants of Orchid Island have been _(20)_ to hang on to their original customs.
 
Q16. (A) to
(B) in
(C) off
(D) on
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        It is a known fact that Taiwan is an island. Just like many other islands, there are smaller islands, such as Green Island and Orchid Island, _(16)_ its coast. The _(17)_ is home to mostly indigenous people.
　　At only 45 square kilometers in area, Orchid Island is small indeed. _(18)_ 800 years ago, the Tao People from the northern Philippines migrated to Orchid Island, which is known as Ponso no Tao in their language. The highest peak on the island is over 500 meters, and the local people _(19)_ in fishing and farming.
　　The island was off-limits to the public during the Japanese occupation, and then under the rule of the Taiwanese government, the ban was lifted in 1967. As a result, the original inhabitants of Orchid Island have been _(20)_ to hang on to their original customs.
 
Q17. (A) former
(B) latter
(C) formal
(D) later
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        It is a known fact that Taiwan is an island. Just like many other islands, there are smaller islands, such as Green Island and Orchid Island, _(16)_ its coast. The _(17)_ is home to mostly indigenous people.

　　The island was off-limits to the public during the Japanese occupation, and then under the rule of the Taiwanese government, the ban was lifted in 1967. As a result, the original inhabitants of Orchid Island have been _(20)_ to hang on to their original customs.

(D) Usually

試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Western movie stars are not the only ones that have made the film industry big. Over the past 20 years, those of Chinese descent _(21)_ greatly to the industry in the US as well. Jet Li, Jackie Chan, Gong Li, and Joan Chen are well-known among cinema lovers. Another star has joined their _(22)_ —Kelly Hu.
　　Born in Honolulu, Hawaii, Kelly is part Hawaiian, Chinese, and English. When she was a child, her older brother taught her some martial arts, a hobby she grew to like. Her good looks _(23)_ her to enter beauty contests, and she won the _(24)_ of Miss Hawaii Teen USA in 1985 and Miss Hawaii USA eight years later.
　　In 1987, she began her acting career. She has appeared in _(25)_ television shows and movies, including The Scorpion King and The Tournament. With such good looks and experience, expect more from Kelly Hu in the future.
 
Q21. (A) have contributed
(B) would contribute
(C) were contributing
(D) contribute
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

　　In 1987, she began her acting career. She has appeared in _(25)_ television shows and movies, including The Scorpion King and The Tournament. With such good looks and experience, expect more from Kelly Hu in the future.

Q38. What happened 65 million years ago?

(C) Dinosaurs died out.
(D) Tuataras died out.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q39. Which of the following facts about tuataras is mentioned in the article?
(A) Their diet
(B) Their size
(C) Their mating habits
(D) The care of their young
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q40. Why is so little known about tuataras?
(A) Dinosaurs protect them.
(B) They lived a very long time ago.
(C) They are extremely small.
(D) They are rare and protected.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

閱讀 第20回

 
Q1. All the evidence shows that the man is the very person ______ robbed Mrs. Wilson of her purse last night.

(A) to
(B) whom
(C) which
(D) that
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q2. No sooner had my parents left home ______ I called and invited all my good friends to a party at my house.

(A) and
(B) so
(C) then
(D) than
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q3. As I cleaned up the house yesterday, I found an old box ______ I used to store all of my toys when I was a kid.

(A) by which
(B) for which
(C) in which
(D) to which
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q4. In general, Taiwanese are nice people; ______, they sometimes put too much emphasis on material wealth.

(A) however
(B) as a result
(C) therefore
(D) besides
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q5. There is hardly ______ word Professor Smith doesn't know, so he might well be called a walking dictionary.

(A) no
(B) some
(C) every
(D) any
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q6. ______ Jack is rich and handsome, Mr. Black won't allow his daughter to marry him, thinking that the young man is unreliable.

(A) Despite
(B) As
(C) Though
(D) Nevertheless
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q7. ______ an oncoming typhoon, the manager has decided to put off the meeting until sometime next week.

(A) Owing to
(B) In spite of
(C) As for
(D) In addition to
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q8. John ______ worry about his work because I will manage to help him with it early tomorrow morning.

(A) needs not
(B) need not
(C) doesn't need
(D) not needs
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q9. My next door neighbors, who moved here two months ago, are ______ nice people that we all like them very much.

(A) how
(B) great
(C) so
(D) such
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說


     
 
Q10. David seems ______ a difficult time in math class last semester. That's why his father is hiring a tutor for him this year.

(A) having
(B) to be having
(C) to have had
(D) to have
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q11. Swimming is a fun, relaxing and healthful activity, but you have to know ______ correctly before going to the deep end of the swimming pool.

(A) how to do
(B) how to do it
(C) what to do it
(D) what to do with
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
 
Q12. Being naughty and playful, Little Johnny was made ______ the classroom after school.

(A) clean up
(B) cleaning up
(C) to clean up
(D) cleaned up
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q13. It's ______ cold outside, so I suggest that we cancel the hiking trip and have a happy get-together in my house instead.

(A) freezing
(B) boiled
(C) bitten
(D) scorching
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說


     
 
Q14. Pearls are unique ______ they are the only gems in the world that are created by living creatures.

(A) for that
(B) except that
(C) in that
(D) with that
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說


     
 
Q15. George is a party animal and thus has problems ______ money, which is something his wife is very worried about.

(A) save
(B) saving
(C) to save
(D) with saving
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說


     
        Native to North America, the raccoon is both loved and hated. For those unfamiliar _(16)_ this mammal, its black eyes are a magnet for pity. The raccoon is also appreciated as a clean animal _(17)_ it is known to wash its food before eating. Raccoons are quick with their hands and are able to hold, pull, and climb like humans.
　　_(18)_, those who live in areas with raccoons usually have quite different feelings towards them. These animals living among humans are known to hunt for food in gardens, trash cans, and bags as well as dumps. They have been known to attack people, too. Even _(19)_, wild raccoons may be carriers of rabies, a serious disease. No matter how friendly these cute animals may seem, it is best to avoid raccoons if you _(20)_ them in the woods.
 
Q16. (A) to
(B) for
(C) about
(D) with
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Native to North America, the raccoon is both loved and hated. For those unfamiliar _(16)_ this mammal, its black eyes are a magnet for pity. The raccoon is also appreciated as a clean animal _(17)_ it is known to wash its food before eating. Raccoons are quick with their hands and are able to hold, pull, and climb like humans.
　　_(18)_, those who live in areas with raccoons usually have quite different feelings towards them. These animals living among humans are known to hunt for food in gardens, trash cans, and bags as well as dumps. They have been known to attack people, too. Even _(19)_, wild raccoons may be carriers of rabies, a serious disease. No matter how friendly these cute animals may seem, it is best to avoid raccoons if you _(20)_ them in the woods.
 
Q17. (A) except that
(B) in that
(C) with that
(D) for that
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Native to North America, the raccoon is both loved and hated. For those unfamiliar _(16)_ this mammal, its black eyes are a magnet for pity. The raccoon is also appreciated as a clean animal _(17)_ it is known to wash its food before eating. Raccoons are quick with their hands and are able to hold, pull, and climb like humans.
　　_(18)_, those who live in areas with raccoons usually have quite different feelings towards them. These animals living among humans are known to hunt for food in gardens, trash cans, and bags as well as dumps. They have been known to attack people, too. Even _(19)_, wild raccoons may be carriers of rabies, a serious disease. No matter how friendly these cute animals may seem, it is best to avoid raccoons if you _(20)_ them in the woods.
 
Q18. (A) Consequently
(B) As a result
(C) Besides
(D) However
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        Native to North America, the raccoon is both loved and hated. For those unfamiliar _(16)_ this mammal, its black eyes are a magnet for pity. The raccoon is also appreciated as a clean animal _(17)_ it is known to wash its food before eating. Raccoons are quick with their hands and are able to hold, pull, and climb like humans.
　　_(18)_, those who live in areas with raccoons usually have quite different feelings towards them. Even _(19)_, wild raccoons may be carriers of rabies, a serious disease. No matter how friendly these cute animals may seem, it is best to avoid raccoons if you _(20)_ them in the woods.

(B) better
(C) bad
(D) worse
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

　　_(18)_, those who live in areas with raccoons usually have quite different feelings towards them. Even _(19)_, wild raccoons may be carriers of rabies, a serious disease. No matter how friendly these cute animals may seem, it is best to avoid raccoons if you _(20)_ them in the woods.
 
Q20. (A) come up
(B) come down
(C) come across
(D) come into
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        One of the most famous women in Chinese history was Wu Ze Tian（武則天）. She was born in 625 and lived until 705. She ruled China through her two sons before she _(21)_ power for herself in 690. During her rule, she was said _(22)_ controlled Korea and Tibet. _(23)_ a highly capable woman, she also increased the size and power of the government.
　　Such strong female rulers _(24)_ Queen Elizabeth of England, Maria Theresa of Austria, or Catherine the Great of Russia are more common in Western history. Therefore, it is noteworthy that Wu Ze Tian was China's only female leader in _(25)_ of Chinese history. Perhaps there will be more and more female leaders in the future.
 
Q21. (A) seized
(B) lost
(C) announced
(D) provided
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

        One of the most famous women in Chinese history was Wu Ze Tian（武則天）. She was born in 625 and lived until 705. She ruled China through her two sons before she _(21)_ power for herself in 690. During her rule, she was said _(22)_ controlled Korea and Tibet. _(23)_ a highly capable woman, she also increased the size and power of the government.
　　Such strong female rulers _(24)_ Queen Elizabeth of England, Maria Theresa of Austria, or Catherine the Great of Russia are more common in Western history. Therefore, it is noteworthy that Wu Ze Tian was China's only female leader in _(25)_ of Chinese history. Perhaps there will be more and more female leaders in the future.

(B) that she has

答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

Q27. According to the advertisement, what is true about BUG OFF?
(A) It will not harm the environment.
(B) It is expensive but useful.
(C) It works best while you sleep.
(D) It may not be used on children.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
試題解說

[文章中譯]

(A) More and More People Are Using Cloud Computing
(B) The Problems and Dangers Related to Cloud Computing
(C) How to Install Cloud Computing on Your Computer
(D) The Meaning and Advantages of Cloud Computing
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q29. According to the article, which is NOT an advantage of cloud computing?
(A) You don't need to buy a computer with a large amount of memory.
(B) You can have access to your files anywhere in the world.
(C) You don't need to spend money buying software.
(D) You can buy a computer at a discount.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： D
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q30. According to the article, how can people save money with cloud computing?
(A) You can use your files from any place in the world.
(B) Cloud computing programs will be free to consumers.
(C) You don't need a computer with a large amount of memory.
(D) The ways people can save money are not stated.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

(B) To complain about a wrong order

Q34. Where was the church located?
(A) In the suburbs of a large city with few offices and inhabitants
(B) In the quiet section of a small city with several churches
(C) In the middle of a large city with many offices but very few inhabitants
(D) In the residential section of a country town with very few offices but many people
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q35. How did the priest react to the man's request?
(A) He gave the full service in accordance with the request.
(B) He lost money by ignoring the request.
(C) He shortened the service by one-fourth, disregarding the request.
(D) He shortened one-fourth of the service, in accordance with the request.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q36. Why didn't the taxi driver want the priest to shorten the service?
(A) Because he was very religious
(B) Because he was an admirer of the priest
(C) Because the longer the service was, the more money he expected to get from the priest
(D) Because he seldom had a chance to go to church on Sundays
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： C
試題解說

Q39. Which of the following statements is true?
(A) Baby frogs have lungs.
(B) Amphibians evolved from fish.
(C) Baby crocodiles have gills.
(D) Lizard skin is moist and smooth.
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： B
試題解說

[文章中譯]

 
Q40. The word overabundance in the second sentence of the last paragraph most nearly means ______.
(A) too many
(B) too few
(C) not enough
(D) many kinds
    
答案 您的答案：未作答       正確答案： A
